Document Title: Electrical machine type selection for high speed supercharger automotive applications
Authors: D. Gerada; H. Zhang; Z. Xu; G. L. Calzo; C. Gerada

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper investigates detailed aspects involved in the electrical machine topology selection for high speed automotive superchargers, through a case study involving a 48V 15kW peak application. The transient nature of the application is taken into account together with the different cooling options available to the electrical machine within the vehicle.

Document Title: Comparative study of different electric propulsion system configurations based on IPMSM drive for battery electric vehicles
Authors: A. M. Omara; M. A. Sleptsov
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Power and Machines Engineering, Tanta University, Egypt; Department of Electrical Transport, Moscow Power Engineering Institute, Russia
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper presents a comparison between three different configurations of battery-powered electric vehicle (EV) propulsion system. Direct torque controlled (DTC) drive system of interior permanent magnet synchronous motor (IPMSM) is proposed. Bidirectional interleaved DC/DC converter is used to adapt the power flow between motor and battery in motoring and regenerative braking operation modes. Rule based power management and control (PMC) algorithm is adopted to manage and control the power flow between different drive systems. The drive and control system of IPMSM is implemented and simulated using MATLAB/SIMLINK. Furthermore, complete vehicle model is established and simulated using AVL CRUISE. Vehicle driving performance is calculated and presented in the simulation results to specify the potential of each propulsion system configuration. The best EV propulsion system is defined by comparing different configuration results to each other.
Author Keywords: AVL CRUISE;battery electric vehicle;DTC;IPMSM

Document Title: Design and analysis of a partitioned stator wound field switched flux machine for electric vehicle
Authors: Z. Z. Wu; Z. Q. Zhu; J. C. Mipo; P. Farah
Author Affiliations: Department of Electronic and Electrical Engineering, University of Sheffield, Sheffield S1 3JD, U.K.; Department of Electronic and Electrical Engineering, University of Sheffield, Sheffield S1 3JD, U.K.; Valeo Powertrain Electric Systems, 94017 Créteil Cedex, France; Valeo Powertrain Electric Systems, 94017 Créteil Cedex, France
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A partitioned stator wound field switched flux machine for electric vehicle is designed and analyzed in this paper. The design process is divided into two stages, i.e. optimal design of dimensional parameters and armature coil turns based on the torque-speed and power-speed curves requirements. The influence of key dimensional parameters on the average electromagnetic torque is investigated. A small scale prototype is built and tested in terms of phase back-EMF and static torque to verify the finite element results.

Document Title: Precise torque control in flux weakening operation based on induction machines system
Authors: W. Cong; X. Huihui; Z. Feng; Z. Jian
Author Affiliations: Key Laboratory of Power Electronics and Electric Drive, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Haidian, Beijing, China; Key Laboratory of Power Electronics and Electric Drive, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Haidian, Beijing, China; Key Laboratory of Power Electronics and Electric Drive, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Haidian, Beijing, China; Key Laboratory of Power Electronics and Electric Drive, Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Haidian, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The induction machines, as one of the main driving systems in electric vehicles(EVs), now are widely used and deeply studied. In most cases the driving system need to act accordingly as the VCU demands a certain torque output. This paper proposes a precise torque control method of Induction Machines (IM). The control algorithm combines flux-weakening control with a 2D look-up table torque controller which ensures the torque precision in a wide speed range. The 2D look-up table is obtained from test results, thus the parameter variation is effectively compensated. Since flux-weakening control is combined, this method is not affected by different DC levels and DC voltage ripple. The proposed torque controller is verified by designed experiments and effective data is required.

Document Title: Optimal design of V-shaped interior PM synchronous machine with narrow rotor space for electric spindle
Authors: C. Qin; R. Qu; D. Li
Author Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China; State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China; State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In recent years, high speed direct drive spindle motors are obtaining more and more attentions due to their compact structure, high efficiency, low vibration and noise. Compared with those of high speed machines used for electric vehicles (EV) and refrigerator compressors, the shaft of a spindle motor is always thicker to satisfy the mechanical support requirement. When the overall outer diameter of a spindle motor is further limited for practical use, the rotor space will be restricted on both the inner and outer side, which makes the machine design process a more challenging work. This paper presents a detailed design procedure of a high speed interior PM spindle permanent magnet (PM) motor. With large volume consumption for the shaft, the rotor space is fully utilized by adopting the inverted interior V shaped PM rotor structure. Firstly, the split ratio is optimized for maximum torque density. Then, the rotor parameters, including the magnet thickness, PM pole arc, angle between adjacent PMs and the bridge width are optimized by finite element analysis (FEA). The simulated results show significant improvement on output performance, i.e. the torque density is increased by 22%. Finally, the analysis results are verified by experimental tests on a 11 Nm, 12000RPM prototype machine.
Author Keywords: electric spindle;torque density;inverted inter permanent magnet machines;skewing;torque ripple
IEEE Terms: Torque;Rotors;Permanent magnet motors;Stators;Synchronous motors;Permanent magnets;Harmonic analysis
INSPEC Controlled Terms: finite element analysis;machine tool spindles;optimisation;permanent magnet motors;rotors;shafts;synchronous motor drives

Document Title: Design and comparison of a new type of magnetic-planetary-geared permanent magnet brushless machine for high torque density
Authors: X. Wang; X. Zhu; C. Zhang; L. Quan; Q. Chen
Author Affiliations: School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Jiangsu University, Zhenjiang, 212013, China; School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Jiangsu University, Zhenjiang, 212013, China; School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Jiangsu University, Zhenjiang, 212013, China; School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Jiangsu University, Zhenjiang, 212013, China; School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Jiangsu University, Zhenjiang, 212013, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper proposes a new type of magnetic-planetary-geared permanent magnet brushless (MPG-PMBL) machines for hybrid electric vehicles (HEVs), which can achieve both power split and combination flexibly, and obtain relatively high efficiency, high torque density, low noise and small size simultaneously. For further improvement of motor performance, four topologies of MPG-PMBL machines are designed based on the different combination of the numbers of magnetic planetary gears and the layers of permanent magnets (PMs). The electromagnetic performances of the four machines are analyzed and compared in detail by the 2D finite element method. The results show the MPG-PMBL with six magnetic planetary gears and two-layer PMs possesses higher torque output capacity.

Document Title: Rotor optimization of permanent magnet synchronous machine in flywheel energy storage system for uninterruptible power system
Authors: W. Gengji; W. Ping; W. Xiaoyuan
Author Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Tianjin University, China; School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Tianjin University, China; School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Tianjin University, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Irreversible demagnetization in permanent magnet synchronous machine (PMSM) rotor due to rotor loss is a problem of high-speed application like flywheel energy storage system (FESS) for uninterruptable power supply (UPS). The efficiency of PMSM is declined by rotor loss. Furthermore, there is irreversible demagnetization in rotor when permanent magnet material is heated to its Curie Temperature. This paper starts with a brief introduction of FESS and theoretical analyze of rotor loss. The experiment and simulation of prototype PMSM are described and illustrated. The available method to reduce rotor loss will be given in the end.

Document Title: Measurement and lumped parameter model of electric machine inductance dependent on frequency and amplitude of current
Authors: D. Bilyi; D. Gerling
Author Affiliations: Electrical drives and actuators, FEAAM GmbH, Neubiberg, Germany; Chair of electrical drives and actuators, Universitaet der Bundeswehr Muenchen, Neubiberg, Germany
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This publication provides the process for obtaining self-inductances of electrical machines with a dependence on frequency and amplitude of an applied alternating current and consideration of a non-linearity and saturation effects in the equivalent circuit lumped parameter model that would have the same frequency and time domain characteristic as some desired investigated electrical machine. The values of inductances were calculated from measured impedances for wide ranges of frequencies and currents according to the theory of a complex inductance and iron losses. The measured data were analyzed and summarized in a table and then used for modeling of an automotive alternator. The model was supplied with curve fitted data. The simulation of a common automotive test case was obtained and compared with measurements. Theory shows a solid correlation with the measurements. Herewith, reasonability of the suggested approach was confirmed.

Document Title: Experiment study of spray characteristics by using PDPA in the large electrical machines
Authors: L. Zhenguo; R. Lin
Author Affiliations: University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, China; Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Spray cooling is a kind of phase change cooling technology. The heat transfer is more effective than traditional and immersing evaporative cooling, due to the combined effect of forced convection and nucleate boiling. In the process, cooling medium is sprayed into certain micro-scale droplets through the nozzles and injected to the stator core and winding. The spray characteristics will affect directly the heat transfer. So in the paper the PDPA (Phase Doppler Particle Analyzer) will be used to analyze the spray characteristics. The basic principle and the measure test of PDPA are described in detail. The experimental result is the key reference for the motor optimization design.

Document Title: Analysis and testing of explosion-protected permanent magnet synchronous machines for operation in hazardous areas
Authors: N. Yogal; C. Lehrmann; M. Henke
Author Affiliations: Explosion-protected Electrical Drive Systems, Physikalisch-Technische Bundesanstalt, Germany; Explosion-protected Electrical Drive Systems, Physikalisch-Technische Bundesanstalt, Germany; Institute for Electrical Machines, Traction and Drives, Technische Universität Braunschweig, Germany
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Permanent magnet synchronous machines (PMSMs) are particularly energy efficient solutions in the modern chemical, mining and automobile industries. The properties of speed-controlled electrical drive systems enable PMSMs to save maximum energy. If electric machines are operated in an explosive atmosphere, it must be ensured that the maximum surface temperature remains below the ignition temperature of the surrounding explosive environment. Proper investigations during the design, manufacturing, and operation of machines should be considered with a minimum possibility of an explosion risk. PMSMs should satisfy safety performance, explosion-proof performance, as well as noise and vibration requirements and should conform to explosion-proof environment criteria.

Authors: R. Fujisawa; H. Inaba; K. Kishine; K. Ishikura; K. Ikebata
Author Affiliations: Department of Electronic Systems Engineering, the University of Shiga Prefecture, Japan; Department of Electronic Systems Engineering, the University of Shiga Prefecture, Japan; Department of Electronic Systems Engineering, the University of Shiga Prefecture, Japan; Mitsubishi Electric Corporation; Department of Electronic Systems Engineering, the University of Shiga Prefecture, Japan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Parallel connected systems constructed by connecting existing power converters in parallel have low costs and can provide large short term output. They can also be easily constructed if the allotment of the converters' output current can be controlled to different values. In this type of construction, however, it is important to reduce the cross current that flows between the converters. This paper reports two kinds of current control methods that were studied, and an examination of their cross current control performances. The performances were compared while taking into account the impedance ratio of the load and the combination reactor and allotment ratio of the output currents from two converter sets.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this paper, a new concept for the application of linear flux-switching permanent magnet (LFSPM) machine to ropeless elevator is proposed. The single-sided LFSPM machine with complementary and modular structure is investigated as a candidate. Moreover, the secondary stator is made of mild steel. The normal upward and downward characteristics of the linear machine are analyzed by the three-dimensional finite-element method. The falling speed of the linear machine in the case of electrical outage is also presented.

Authors: Y. Li; Y. Wu; X. Liu

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: As an important basic course for electrical engineering and automation specialty, Electrical Machinery plays a link role between other professional basic courses and its professional courses during the undergraduate study stage. Satisfying the strategic requirement of the current social development and adhering to the idea of cultivating one's own personnel, this paper, based on the construction of the national quality resource sharing course of Electrical Machinery, first proposes altering the traditional teaching mode of merely imparting knowledge and applying both the engineering cognition theory and modern information technology in the course teaching. Moreover, it states that the teaching process is integrated into scientific and technological advance as well as practical application. Ultimately, the courser forms and renovates the traditional teaching methods aiming to construct the talent training mode of combining teaching with scientific research. We have got good results and great successes in our active teaching research.

Document Title: An asymmetrical six-phase induction machine-based flywheel energy storage system using modular multilevel converters
Authors: M. I. Daoud; A. Massoud; A. Abdel-Khalik; S. Ahmed
Author Affiliations: Qatar University, Qatar; Qatar University, Qatar; Texas A&M University at Qatar, Qatar; Texas A&M University at Qatar, Qatar
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Energy storage systems have become an essential pillar in most of electrical engineering applications due to introduced technical and economical merits, particularly following the pronounced grid-integration of renewable energy sources. Flywheel Energy Storage Systems (FESSs) have emerged as reliable and cost effective short term storage system. FESS may be used for critical load support or fault ride-through purposes, therefore the FESS reliability must be ensured. In this paper, FESSs are investigated for medium voltage applications where the main concern is the FESS's reliability. The main challenge for medium voltage FESS is the driving machine ratings and interfacing power conversion system. Therefore, two-parallel three-phase Modular Multilevel Converters (MMCs) are proposed to drive an asymmetrical six-phase Induction Machine (IM) in order to reduce the DC link voltage of the medium voltage system into a proper level for the IMs, where each converter is connected to feed each three-phase set of the six-phase machine. The employment of MMCs and an asymmetrical six-phase IM enhances system reliability as well. The machine and converter mathematical models are presented in this paper. Moreover, a simulation case study for FESS control under the proposed configuration is investigated.
Author Keywords: Asymmetrical six-phase induction machine;Flywheel energy storage;Modular multilevel converter
INSPEC Controlled Terms: asynchronous machines;flywheels;mathematical analysis;power convertors;reliability;renewable energy sources
INSPEC Non-Controlled Terms: asymmetrical six-phase induction machine;flywheel energy storage system;FESS reliability;modular multilevel converters;MMC;renewable energy sources grid-integration;fault ride-through;power conversion system

Document Title: Experimental evaluation of online parameter identification method based on cluster technique for EV and HEV
Authors: H. Khreis; A. Deflorio; W. Lee; B. Schmuelling
Author Affiliations: Gasoline Systems, System eDrive, Robert Bosch GmbH, D-71701 Schwieberdingen, Germany; Gasoline Systems, System eDrive, Robert Bosch GmbH, D-71701 Schwieberdingen, Germany; Gasoline Systems, System eDrive, Robert Bosch GmbH, D-71701 Schwieberdingen, Germany; E-Mobility Research Group, University of Wuppertal, D-42119 Wuppertal, Germany
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In electric and hybrid electric vehicles, the torque is calculated based on a machine model. Thus, precise knowledge of the machine's electrical parameters is required for optimal field oriented control and torque accuracy. This work presents the experimental application of a novel online parameter identification method. It is based on clustering technique and uses the information of stator currents, voltages, and electrical frequency. Using this method, all electrical parameters can be simultaneously identified with low computational costs. The algorithm is tested on the test bench with a 75-kW permanent magnet synchronous machine for electric and hybrid electric vehicles made by Bosch. Experimental results confirm the efficiency of the proposed methodology.

Abstract: In this paper, the influence of saturation and cross-coupling effects on the copper loss minimization for synchronous machines with strong saliencies, especially the PMa-SynRM and RSM are analyzed. It is shown that state-of-the-art methods for saturation consideration through the absolute inductances fail for these machines A novel method for Maximum Torque per Ampere estimation, which includes the consideration of these effects through the use of differential inductances, is proposed and its effectiveness is shown through Finite Element Analysis.

Document Title: Production friendly design and development of brushless DC machines
Authors: S. Kulkarni; A. Pendse; P. Wagh; M. Sonawane; O. Pawaskar; M. Bhawalkar; M. Kulkarni
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, PVG's College of Engineering & Technology, Pune, India; Department of Electrical Engineering, PVG's College of Engineering & Technology, Pune, India; Department of Electrical Engineering, PVG's College of Engineering & Technology, Pune, India; Department of Electrical Engineering, PVG's College of Engineering & Technology, Pune, India; Department of Electrical Engineering, PVG's College of Engineering & Technology, Pune, India; Department of Electrical Engineering, PVG's College of Engineering & Technology, Pune, India; MMSU Electric, Pune, India
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Many sophisticated control applications need reliable, maintenance-free and efficient drives. Brushless DC Motor is one of such machine which is now widely used due to compactness of motor and drive unit and replacing large number of conventional machines to a greater extent. The numerous benefits of Brushless DC motors are high torque to weight ratio, higher torque, less inertia and use of electronic commutation. The magnetic fields produced by stator and rotor interact to develop torque. The special construction of stator lamination with concentrated winding are responsible for trapezoidal shape gap flux density distribution and induced EMF. However use of special laminations for stator can be costly with larger material wastage. It is therefore necessary to adopt innovative approach for design of BLDC machine. One of the unusual approach is presented here in which standard laminations used for induction machine are employed in stator of new BLDC machine. Innovative winding arrangement is used to create desired number of poles. The design data is used to simulate analytical model of the machine for validation of design by using finite element analysis. A prototype is also fabricated or judging appropriateness of design.
Author Keywords: Surface Mounted BLDC;Interior Permanent Magnet BLDC;Finite element Analysis;Hall Sensors

Document Title: A regenerative braking system for switched reluctance machine applied to electric vehicles

Author Affiliations: Department of Systems and Naval Mechatronic Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan; Department of Electrical Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan; Department of Electrical Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan; Department of Systems and Naval Mechatronic Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan; Electric Motor Technology Research Center, National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan; Electric Motor Technology Research Center, National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan; Department of Electrical Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper presents the control strategies of switched reluctance machine (SRM) applied to EV traction for operations in generating mode. The proposed approach is capable of preventing the exciting current entering the ascending-inductance region so that the unwanted motoring action can be utterly avoided. This can enhance the efficiency of energy recovery during the braking period and is beneficial for electric vehicle applications by recovering as much energy as possible to increase the cruising endurance. Simulation and experiments on an SRM are conducted to verify the proposed method.

Authors: K. Yuki; Y. Shimizu; M. Terai; Y. Mochizuki; I. Yasuoka; G. Hongguang; T. Q. Zheng

Document Title: Torque ripple reduction for non-sinusoidal back-EMF permanent magnet synchronous machines with current harmonics
Authors: Z. Li; Z. Chen; S. Lu; S. Yang; M. Xu
Author Affiliations: Electric Power Science Research Institute, Jiangsu Electric Power Company, Nanjing, 211103, China; College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, 211100, China; Electric Power Science Research Institute, Jiangsu Electric Power Company, Nanjing, 211103, China; Electric Power Science Research Institute, Jiangsu Electric Power Company, Nanjing, 211103, China; Electric Power Science Research Institute, Jiangsu Electric Power Company, Nanjing, 211103, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In order to analysis the influence of current harmonic on electromagnetic torque, a model of electromagnetic torque is proposed considering back electromotive force (back-EMF) harmonics in permanent-magnet synchronous machine (PMSM). Based on this model, electromagnetic torque is divided into four parts. The amplitude and phase angle of harmonic current are solved to minimize torque ripple of each part and their effects on average torque value are discussed. Further, conclusions are applied to torque ripple suppression in permanent magnet synchronous machine, which is validated by finite element (FE) method. Results show that, when back-EMF waveform is non-sinusoidal, lower torque ripple can be obtained by injecting proper current harmonic components into the fundamental current than just reducing current harmonics.

Document Title: Influence of pole number on characteristics of permanent magnet synchronous machines under space limitation
Authors: Q. Li; T. Fan; X. Wen; Y. Li; X. Tai
Author Affiliations: Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences; Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences; Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences; Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences; Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Pole number is the key parameter of permanent magnet synchronous machines (PMSMs) for some space limitation applications, especially electric vehicle. This paper focuses on investigating the influence of pole number on the electromagnetic and thermal characteristics of PMSMs for applications under space limitation. The analytical calculation methods of electromagnetic and thermal characteristics are introduced, and a set of PMSMs are employed to study the effect of pole number on copper and iron losses, motor efficiency and winding temperature rise. Those PMSMs have different pole number and the same overall dimensions, as the pole number is varied from 8 to 24. Finally, two optimal PMSMs are built the simulation models, one is optimized for maximum motor efficiency, and the other is designed for minimum winding temperature rise. The characteristics of two optimal PMSMs are analyzed by the finite element analysis (FEA), and compared analytical results.
Author Keywords: PMSMs;pole number;electromagnetic characteristics;thermal characteristics

Document Title: Equivalent circuit constants estimation of induction machine with a closed slot rotor by DC decay testing method
Authors: K. Takeuchi; M. Matsushita; Y. Tsuboi; H. Tsutsui
Author Affiliations: TOSHIBA Corporation, Japan; TOSHIBA Corporation, Japan; TOSHIBA MITSUBISHI-ELECTRIC Industrial Systems Corporation, Japan; TOSHIBA MITSUBISHI-ELECTRIC Industrial Systems Corporation, Japan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: DC decay testing method is effective to estimate equivalent circuit constants of induction machine (IM), since the measurements require only a small DC power supply and can be carried out without a machine rotation. However, in case of testing an IM with a closed slot rotor (ex. aluminum die-cast rotor), the constants obtained by a usual DC decay test may include some errors because the secondary leakage inductance varies depending on a magnetic saturation in bridge areas of the rotor. This paper proposes applying a DC decay test with superimposed current to solve the problem above. Measurement results conducted on a 4P-15kW IM showed that the accurate constants were obtained by adjusting the value of the superimposed current.

Authors: Z. Qiu; J. Zhang; P. Ning; X. Wen

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Insulated gate bipolar transistors (IGBTs) are the critical components for electrical vehicle inverter. This paper introduced a general approach of lifetime evaluation of IGBT modules for electric vehicles mission-profile. A general evaluation procedure were provided and discussed. The driving cycle FTP-75 was used as an input to the lifetime evaluation procedure. The lifetime of IGBT modules in electrical vehicle inverters could be obtained according to this procedure. Cases applying this lifetime evaluation method were presented for selection of IGBT modules and design of reliability tests for electrical vehicle inverters. The 760 hours power cycling test was equivalent of the duty time 30 years for electric vehicles mission-profile.

Abstract: The 21<sup>st</sup> COP, hosted in Paris, France, in December 2015, selected Paris Agreement that mandated all countries to participate in the global response to climate change. With this, the rail transportation system in Korea is undergoing active research on low-carbon emitting technologies. The current paper designs photovoltaic power generation system using the rooftop of Gwangmyeong Station, the largest railway station building in Korea, and calculates predicted power generation volume using PVsyst. Document Title: A new sensorless control method for PM machine with 180 degree commutation
Authors: J. Wu; Z. Deng; C. Wang; X. Sun
Author Affiliations: College of Automation Engineering, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing, China; College of Automation Engineering, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing, China; College of Automation Engineering, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing, China; College of Automation Engineering, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: For the permanent magnet (PM) machine, 180 degree commutation method can reduce the switching frequency and increase the voltage utilization, which is suitable for high speed operation. However, higher speed operation needs more precise position sensor which is relatively expensive. To increase the reliability and reduce the cost, a new sensorless control method is proposed for the PM machine with 180 degree commutation. A phase current based function and bus voltage are compared to get the zero-crossing point (ZCP) of the phase back electromotive force (back-EMF), which is correspond to the commutation point. The proposed method is relatively simple and potentially low-cost as it only needs two current and one voltage signals. Both of the simulation and experiment are implemented and the results approve the validity of the new sensorless method.
Author Keywords: Back electromotive force (back-EMF);permanent magnet (PM) machine;sensorless control;180 degree commutation

Document Title: Sensor fault tolerant control method for electric traction PWM rectifier using sliding mode observer
Authors: J. Xia; Y. Guo; B. Dai; X. Zhang
Author Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Dalian University of Technology, China; School of Electrical Engineering, Dalian University of Technology, China; School of Electrical Engineering, Dalian University of Technology, China; School of Electrical Engineering, Dalian University of Technology, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The single-phase PWM rectifier is the main component of the AC-DC-AC converters in high-speed railway electric traction system. This paper presents a fast and robust fault diagnosis and fault tolerant control method for the catenary current and DC-link voltage sensor faults in the single-phase PWM rectifier control system. The sliding mode observer (SMO) including inserted linear correction term is designed. The residuals are generated between measurements and observed values. The fault diagnosis unit locates the faulty sensors in few sampling periods by comparing residuals with thresholds. The analytical redundancy is employed in the control reconfiguration. Simulation results are presented to verify the effectiveness and reliability of the proposed strategy.

Authors: K. Xie; R. Qu; D. Li
Author Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China; State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China; State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Flux switching (FS-) PM machines have gained lots of attentions in recent years, and many topologies have been proposed. In this paper, a quantitative comparison among regular PM machines including 12/10 slot/pole surface-mounted, spoke-PM machines and 12/10, 6/10, 6/13 slot/pole FSPM machines, especially the partitioned-stator one, is presented. Based on the finite element analysis, the electromagnetic performances, such as back-EMF, cogging torque, and torque ripple, are comprehensively investigated. Analysis results show that these FSPM machines are easier to get into saturation than other machines as the current density increases, and the spoke-PM machine exhibits highest torque density when current density exceeds about 6 A/mm<sup>2</sup> with relatively low torque ripple and good utilization of magnets.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The inevitable temperature raise leads to the demagnetization of permanent magnet synchronous motor (PMSM), that is undesirable in the application of electrical vehicle. This paper presents a nonlinear demagnetization model taking into account temperature with the Wiener structure and neural network characteristics. The remanence and intrinsic coercivity are chosen as intermediate variables, thus the relationship between motor temperature and maximal permanent magnet flux is described by the proposed neural Wiener model. Simulation and experimental results demonstrate the precision of temperature dependent demagnetization model. This work makes the basis of temperature compensation for the output torque from PMSM.

Authors: Z. Chen; H. Ma; Z. Li

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Surface-mounted and interior hybrid permanent magnet synchronous machine (SIHPMSM) is introduced in this paper. Finite element model of SIHPMSM is built to investigate its no-load and load characteristics. In order to study the effects of surface-mounted permanent magnet (SPM) and interior permanent magnet (IPM) on this machine, three FE models are built and analyzed. Flux density, back-EMF and torque performances of them are compared. Results show that surface-mounted magnets have greater impact on no-load characteristic of this machine than interior permanent magnet, while the load characteristic is mainly affected by interior permanent magnet.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Magnetic gears (MGs) have received extensive attention in the last decade. The flux-modulated machine (FMM) is one of the derived topologies from the MG. The existing FMMs which mostly adopt the radial-flux configuration suffer from a relatively low torque density compared with other MG-integrated machines. This paper proposes a novel axial-radial flux-modulated machine which has an improved torque density. Performances are compared with a radial-flux FMM to validate the superiority of the proposed topology. The results show that the proposed structure has a higher torque density, especially with a small length-to-diameter ratio.

Abstract: Basic. Generator control unit design plays a crucial role in the design of the aircraft power system, therefore it's necessary to model and simulate. The rapid development of aeronautical technology puts forward higher requirements to reliability and quality of power supply system, and traditional simulation software is unable to meet the demand. Since Dymola software designed by Sweden Dynasim AB Company is a multi-disciplinary simulation software, which having been increasingly widely used in various fields. Abstract: This paper presents a magnetic circuit network (MCN) model of surface-inset permanent magnet (SIPM) machines. Document Title: Direct parameter-based torque ripple minimization of synchronous reluctance machines
Authors: B. Lehner; D. Gerling
Author Affiliations: Chair of Electrical Drives and Actuators, Universitaet der Bundeswehr Muenchen, Neubiberg, Germany; Chair of Electrical Drives and Actuators, Universitaet der Bundeswehr Muenchen, Neubiberg, Germany
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The focus in this paper is on maximizing average torque and minimizing torque ripple in synchronous reluctance machines, using finite element-based design optimization. The procedure is based on using fully parametrized geometries of the machine's magnetic circuit. Crucial dimensions of the rotor geometry were incorporated into the optimization process. The main idea to reduce torque oscillation is obtaining an additional degree of freedom by using asymmetric pole shapes regarding the angle between adjacent direct axes of the rotor. It is shown that for full pitch distributed winding machines, low values of torque ripple can be achieved even without skewing. By additionally skewing the rotor, also for concentrated winding machines suitable low torque ripple values are obtainable. A limited set of input variables implicates a reduction of computing effort in comparison to other optimization procedures.

Document Title: Design parameter curve calculation of 300MW generator-motor based on finite element method
Authors: J. Chen; L. Ruan
Author Affiliations: Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, China; Institute of Electrical Engineering, Chinese Academy of Sciences, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Plenty of design parameters are used during electric machine design process. Generally, design parameters are looked up from existing curves drawn by magnetic field graphing method or analytical method. Affected by different draftsmen's proficiency, precision of parameter curves drawn by magnetic field graphing method have uncertainty. Using analytical drawing method to draw design parameter curves usually simplifies analytical model of electric machine to improve calculating efficiency. But simplified analysis model results in more or less accuracy problems. In order to improve the accuracy of electric machines design calculation, finite element method (FEM) is used to analyze electromagnetic field and calculate design parameters based on complete electric machine model in this paper. As the analytic objects are a series of 300MW evaporative cooled generator-motor, design parameter curves drawn in this paper should be more accurate than existing curves for electric machine with similar size and structure.

Authors: M. Luo; H. Zhou; J. Duan; B. Kou
Author Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of High Performance Complex Manufacturing, Central South University, Changsha, 410083, China; State Key Laboratory of High Performance Complex Manufacturing, Central South University, Changsha, 410083, China; State Key Laboratory of High Performance Complex Manufacturing, Central South University, Changsha, 410083, China; School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, 150001, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Voice coil motor (VCM) is a kind of direct drive motor widely used in multidimensional precision machining systems, which is of characteristics with high precision and high frequency response. This paper proposes a servo control system for a novel linear-rotary voice coil motor (LRVCM) which achieves a two-degree-of-freedom motion by one motor. Initially the basic structure of the novel LRVCM is described here. The linear-rotary mathematical models are set up to study a suitable control method. A triple closed-loop control system is proposed, and the transfer function relationship of the servo control system is analyzed. Fuzzy control and feedforward control are provided to obtain preferable system performance. The paper provides the analyses and design method of a high precision and quick response servo control system for the novel LRVCM, the references of control and drive design for LRVCM in precision machining systems are discussed.

Abstract: Linear switched reluctance machines (LSRM) have a relatively low force output and high force ripples. This paper discusses a double-sided linear hybrid switched reluctance machine (LHSRM) which includes permanent magnets to be embedded into the stator leg slots. The proposed LHSRM has hybrid excitation flux circuits, derived from the permanent magnets and external current excitations. Machine design based on the equivalent magnetic circuit analysis and the performance evaluation is carried out by the finite element methods (FEM). Simulation results demonstrate that the LHSRM has better propulsion force output performance with reduced force ripples, as compared to the pure LSRM without PMs at the same dimensions. Experimental measurement results verify that the proposed linear machine possesses a higher average force with a lower force ripple factor.

Secondly the Simulation model of Master-slave rectifier parallel operation control system is set up in MATLAB for simulation, the current instructions of Master rectifier transmitted with delay to the Slave rectifier has a great influence on dynamic process of parallel operation. Abstract: The Brushless Doubly-Fed Machine is a new type electrical machine having some typical characteristics similar to a normal synchronous machine. Reactive power regulating and the V-curve are some of them. By adjusting the control winding current of the machine, the reactive power of the power winding drawn from the grid can be changed and the power factor can be improved consequently. In this paper, a new vector control scheme for the BDFM based on power winding flux orientation is also proposed. So the speed of the machine and the power factor of the power winding can be controlled respectively. At last, some experiments were implemented on a 30 kW wound rotor prototype BDFM, and the results verify the good performance of this type of control.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper proposes an inrush current suppressor for a squirrel-cage induction machine (SCIM) with phase-leading capacitors using a matrix converter (MC) in a large-capacity wind power generation system (WPGS). The reference output voltage of the MC is determined by multiplying the SCIM current with the variable control gain. Thus, the MC performs as resistors for the inrush current of an SCIM with phase-leading capacitors. Digital computer simulations show that the proposed inrush current suppressor results in a notch depth of the receiving-end voltage within 13.7% of nominal. Simulation results also demonstrate that the proposed inrush current suppressor can suppress the inrush current drawn by phase-leading capacitors.

Abstract: Motor reliability research has received extensive attention and the bearing is one of components with the highest failure rates in the machine. In this paper, the inherent shaft voltage of flux-switching permanent magnet (FSPM) machine is analyzed which associated with motor structure of Stator-PM machine. Abstract: This paper proposes an advanced spoke type permanent magnet (PM) servo motor with high torque density. The optimizations of split ratio and trapezoidal magnet dimensions are performed, and unequal airgap is employed to reduce the cogging torque. The designed trapezoidal magnets are used in one 3 Nm prototype to remove the rotor iron bridge, which introduces heavy leakage flux especially for the brushless PM motors with small size. The comparison of the proposed spoke type PM machine and regular surface mounted PM (SPM) machine is presented by finite element analysis (FEA) and validated by experiments. The results show that the torque density of the proposed spoke type PM motor can be 22% higher than that of the regular SPM motor under same temperature rise.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In the high-speed permanent magnet synchronous motor(HS-PMSM) driver system, the current sampling is not accurate enough to support the calculation of complicated algorithm (vector control, direct torque control, etc.) since the current varies significantly in a single pulse-width modulation (PWM) period because of the small parameter of the HS-PMSM due to the high speed design. In this article a novel current sampling method is presented, which integrated the current signal for one PWM period and calculate the arithmetic average based on the hardware circuit platform. However, the method avoids the cost of software and computing power, which is precious in the HS-PMSM driver system. Simulation results show that the proposed sampling method can reduce the current ripple and harmonics to achieve a low THD and more steady operate state.

Document Title: Rotor design with and without permanent magnets and performance evaluation of synchronous reluctance motors
Authors: M. N. Ibrahim; P. Sergeant; E. M. Rashad
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Energy, Systems and Automation, Ghent University, Ghent 9000, Belgium; Department of Electrical Energy, Systems and Automation, Ghent University, Ghent 9000, Belgium; Electrical Power and Machines Department, Tanta University, Tanta 31527, Egypt
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Nowadays, low cost and high efficiency electrical motors are useful in order to reduce the growing energy consumption. Synchronous Reluctance Motors (SynRMs) with and without permanent magnets (PMs) have a somewhat higher efficiency and nevertheless acceptable cost compared to induction machines. This paper focuses on the rotor design without magnets and with PMs and its impact on the performance (torque, power factor and efficiency) of SynRMs. Moreover, the influence of different rotors on the magnetic saturation of the motor is studied. A low cost ferrite PM amount has been added into the optimized rotor of the SynRM to obtain a PM assisted SynRM. A comparison between the motor performance for both reference, optimal and PM rotors has been employed using FEM. It was found that the torque density and the efficiency of the machine increased by about 9.5% and 0.18% respectively when replacing the reference rotor by the optimal one, and by 15% and 0.55% respectively when inserting ferrite PMs in the center of the optimal rotor. In addition, the power factor of the optimal SynRM increased by 17.6% with inserted PMs. The SynRM efficiency and power factor can reach 95.63% and 0.93 respectively. For the reference motor, the simulation results have been validated by measured results.

Authors: J. Wang; Z. Li; L. Xu; L. Zhou
Author Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China; State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China; State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China; State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Interior permanent magnet (IPM) brushless machines are widely used in various applications due to the advantages of high efficiency, high power density and wide constant power operating range and so on. However, the conventional vector control based on Park transformation with digital PI current controller can only serve for the control of fundamental current. This paper proposes a novel vector control technique based on general synchronous rotating coordinate transformation for IPM brushless machines with non-sinusoidal Back-EMF. With the proposed method, the maximum torque per ampere control (MTPA) and torque ripple mitigation drive operation can be obtained simultaneously. The novel vector control technique injects optimal excitation currents including abundant harmonic components into the armature windings of a motor without static error. With the proposed rotating coordinate transformation, the torque equation is simplified as that with Park transformation for ideally sinusoidal permanent magnet synchronous machines. The validity of the proposed technique is verified through simulation results using Matlab/Simulink and experiments.

Document Title: Impact of single layer, double layer and four layer windings on the performance of AFPMSMs
Authors: A. Hemeida; P. Sergeant
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Energy, Systems and Automation, Ghent University, Ghent 9000, Belgium; Department of Electrical Energy, Systems and Automation, Ghent University, Ghent 9000, Belgium
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this paper, the impact of an increased number of layers on the performance of axial flux permanent magnet synchronous machines (AFPMSMs) is studied. The studied parameters are the inductance, terminal voltages, PM losses, iron losses, the mean value of torque, and the ripple torque. It is shown that increasing the number of layers reduces the fundamental winding factor. In consequence, the rated torque for the same current reduces. However, the reduction of harmonics associated with a higher number of layers reduces the ripple torque, PM losses, and iron losses. Besides studying the performance of the AFPMSMs for the rated conditions, the study is broadened for the field weakening (FW) region. During the FW region, the flux of the PMs is weakened by an injection of a reversible d-axis current. This keeps the terminal voltage of the machine fixed at the rated value. The inductance plays an important role in the FW study. A complete study for the FW shows that the two layer winding has the optimum performance compared to machines with an other number of winding layers.
Author Keywords: AFPMSM;Field Weakening;Iron Losses;Layers;PM losses

Abstract: High energy density lithium ion battery (LiB) is utilized to power the electric vehicles (EVs). Abstract: This paper focus on energy efficiency comparison and analysis of different DC power distribution mode for large data center. First, several single-module DC power supply systems with different voltage level and power capacity are applied to substitute for UPS based AC distribution mode for a typical data center of high-tech park with many enterprises. Secondly, system efficiency, power supply loss factor(PLF) and power usage effectiveness(PUE) are used respectively to analyze and evaluate the energy efficiency of power supply system with IT equipment. Abstract: This paper presents a performance comparison between different high-speed (HS) permanent-magnet (PM) topologies for electrically assisted turbocharger (EAT) applications. The focus of the research is mainly on the efficiency and torque capability comparison of three surface-mounted PM machines: a slotless toroidally wound, and two 6-slot machines having different slot shapes. The base specification of the application is 15 kW @ 150 krpm. Mechanical considerations and general guidelines are also given in the paper to ensure a realistic design of the motor regarding the application. Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Due to the superior dynamic performance of the field oriented control technique, Induction Motors (IM) are the workhorses of industries. Core Loss (CL) and Stray Load Loss (SLL) are generally neglected in developing of the mathematical model of IM. But they should be considered in the mathematical model of IM from a viewpoint of precise control of speed and torque. Though PI based control strategy is often used to control the speed of IM, conventional PI controller, in general, has very poor performance in transient response. Artificial Neural Network (ANN) is gaining momentum as a controller for nonlinear system. This paper presents the ANN based speed control scheme of IM with considering CL and SLL. Simulation analyses are performed for both transient and steady state conditions. The results are presented in the cases of traditional PI controller and proposed ANN speed controller. The results show the overshoot can be minimized by using the proposed control scheme. The simulations have been carried out by using MATLAB/SIMULINK environment.

Authors: Z. Gu; K. Wang; R. Cao; C. Liu

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In multi-phase machines, the third harmonic current can interact with the third harmonic back-EMF to improve the output torque. This paper investigates the unequal tooth width and permanent magnet (PM) segmentation techniques to improve the third harmonic back-EMF of the five phase 10-slot/8-pole surface-mounted permanent magnet (SPM) machine. It is found that the fundamental and third harmonic winding factors are increased by the unequal tooth width. Meanwhile, the third harmonic airgap flux density is improved but the fundamental airgap flux density is reduced by segmenting the PM. The optimal unequal tooth dimensions and PM segmentations are given for maximizing the output torque. The airgap flux density, back-EMFs, cogging torques and output torques of the machine with equal tooth width, unsegmented PM and with unequal tooth width, segmented PM are compared.

Authors: P. S. Kumar; L. Xie; B. Soong
Author Affiliations: School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore; School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore; School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The present condition monitoring of rotating electric machines are predominantly based on electrical signals available from the stator terminal leads and other physical quantities from external of the machine, while signals internal to the machine remain relatively unexplored. For the ease of deployment of sensing system inside an electrical machine with minimum overall design modification, wireless sensor nodes would be an ideal choice, especially while probing signals on the rotor. In this paper, we investigate and evaluate the feasibility of applying IEEE 802.15.4 based wireless radio within an electrical machine. Based on the experiments carried out using an electromagnet and an induction machine, it was found that contrary to the common belief, the wireless link quality was observed to be improved and not degraded due to the environmental conditions inside an electrical machine. This opens up an opportunity to explore invasive condition monitoring systems for electrical machines.

Abstract: A resistance-or inductance-based saliency is needed as a prerequisite for signal-injection based encoderless position estimation methods. This can be achieved by applying a short-circuited electrical winding on the rotor of an interior permanent magnet synchronous machine (IPMSM). For a reliable modelling approach, it is essential to know which non-ideal effects like hysteresis or eddy currents have to be considered and how much they influence the HF-quantities of the considered machine. Therefore, the frequency- and operating-point-dependency of the flux distribution in the rotor and the HF-impedance of the arrangement with and without the short-circuited rotor winding were examined by using a fundamental experimental setup. Based on these results, the electromagnetic behavior of the experimental setup is described by a simple coil model.

Abstract: This paper presents the design considerations of a highly integrated novel outer-rotor interior permanent magnet(ORIPM) motor which is suitable for in-wheel direct propulsion. And in the rotor structure design, the inverted V-shape PMs and asymmetric flux barriers (AFB) are combined together in order to obtain a satisfying torque output. Authors: H. Zhang; C. Fang; H. Xu; C. Xiong; Z. Zhang
Author Affiliations: University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; Institute of Electrical Engineering Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; Institute of Electrical Engineering Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; Institute of Electrical Engineering Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; Institute of Electrical Engineering Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The output air volume of a fan motor will be different and not a constant value all the time when the fan motor works. There are mainly two aspect reasons. On one hand, for one given fan motor, the pipeline resistance will change because of the clogging of the filter and other reasons. On the other hand, for different fan motors, the motor efficiencies are not the same. The paper presents a constant air flow control method without using air volume sensor. The method can adjust the air-blower speed automatically to keep a constant air volume by measuring the fan motors parameters under different working conditions in real time. The single-chip XC866 is used as the core of the control system, which controls the output air volume automatically by detecting signals of voltage, current and rotor position. The result proves that a constant output air volume can be achieved under different expected air volume values for fan motors by using the method based on sensorless and it also has a high precision.

Therefore, when designing a vehicle electric motor, it is necessary to design motor in order to reduce no-load back electromotive force in coasting and harmonics in high speed. Abstract: In this paper, a semi analytical model for magnet losses calculation in high speed permanent magnet synchronous machines (PMSMs) is presented and verified. Abstract: As the permanent magnet synchronous motor (PMSM) system is the main part of the Flywheel Energy Storage (FES) system which has great influence on the loss of FES system, it is important to improve the efficiency of the PMSM system. This paper presents an analytical nonlinear loss model of the PMSM system which can calculates the PMSM loss and power converter loss together by the torque and speed. The PMSM loss predicted by the analytical model can take the copper loss and iron loss into account in magnetic circuit. The nonlinear characteristics of the switching loss and conduction loss in the power converter can be also considered in the nonlinear model. Based on the system loss model, the maximum efficiency control is proposed to make the system maintain maximum efficiency in the whole range of operating conditions for the FES system. The maximum efficiency control can optimize the copper loss, iron loss and power converter loss together. By the use of the SiC MOSFETs, the PMSM system can decrease the switching loss of power devices significantly and increase the efficiency of system. Both numerical analysis and experiments show that the maximum efficiency control can improve the performance of the PMSM system and approach a remarkably efficiency of the FES system.
Author Keywords: Loss of PMSM;loss of power converter;system efficiency optimization;PMSM system

Document Title: Analysis of power quality issue in arc furnace capacitor bank system
Authors: B. Sreewirote; A. Ngaopitakkul
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Faculty of Engineering Thonburi University, Bangkok, 10160, Thailand; Faculty of Engineering, King Mongkut's Institute of Technology Ladkrabang, Chalongkrung Road, Ladkrabang, Bangkok 10520, Thailand
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In large furnace industry in Thailand, power factor has become a concerned issue due to electric utility department that charges extra money from factory causing low power factor. Many factories have been using capacitor bank to compensate reactive power, thus, increasing power factor in factory. With the capacitor bank, power quality in terms of harmonic current has become problem due to the switching transient that magnifies current harmonics and causes severe damage to capacitor bank and other nearby sensitive equipment. This paper aims to study power quality issue in terms of harmonics in steel furnace factory and its effect when switching capacitor bank into system. The study is done by using data from furnace plant in Phetchaburi province, Thailand as case study. The result reveals that after switching capacitor bank, harmonics have been significantly increased, thus, protection scheme must be implemented to ensure safety and reliability of the plant.

The copper loss of litz wire can be calculated in a practical computation time.

Authors: T. Izumi; N. Hatano; S. Ogata; H. Matsumura; K. Izumi; K. Asano
Author Affiliations: Power System Technology Laboratory, R&D Center, The Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc., 3-11-20 Nakoji, Amagasaki, Hyogo, Japan; Power System Technology Laboratory, R&D Center, The Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc., 3-11-20 Nakoji, Amagasaki, Hyogo, Japan; Power System Technology Laboratory, R&D Center, The Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc., 3-11-20 Nakoji, Amagasaki, Hyogo, Japan; Control Equipment Division, Enegate Co., Ltd., 3-14-40 Senrioka, Settsu, Osaka, Japan; Control Equipment Division, Enegate Co., Ltd., 3-14-40 Senrioka, Settsu, Osaka, Japan; Power System Technology Laboratory, R&D Center, The Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc., 3-11-20 Nakoji, Amagasaki, Hyogo, Japan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A fanless 30 kVA Uninterruptible Power System (UPS) has been developed using full silicon carbide (SiC) power modules. The SiC-UPS is equipped with natural air-cooled heat sinks designed based on thermal fluid analysis in order to improve the efficiency of heat transfer for a fanless system. The junction temperatures of the SiC device are sufficiently lower than the allowable junction temperature under the condition of 30 kVA of rated output power, and the fanless SiC-UPS has been confirmed to have adequate cooling performance. The fanless SiC-UPS achieves high power efficiency about 2.8% higher than that of our conventional forced air-cooled Si-UPS and about 0.7% higher than that of a fabricated forced air-cooled SiC-UPS. In addition, the power loss of its converter unit is successfully reduced by about 35% compared to our conventional forced air-cooled Si-UPS. These improvements are expected to make beneficial maintenance-saving of the UPS possible in an electric power system.

Abstract: In automotive applications, motors are required to have high power, high efficiency, and small size. Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Fault-tolerant operation of multi-drive is an important aspect of system reliability in specific fields such as electric vehicles and rail transits. This paper proposes a new fault-tolerant control strategy for three-motor drive based on neural network right inversion (NNRI). The key of this strategy is to use NNRI to approximate the right-inverse system of three-motor drive under both healthy and faulty condition. A pseudo-linear system is completed by constructing the NNRI system and combing it with three-motor drive. The capability of fault tolerance can be enhanced. Meanwhile, the proposed strategy can solve the coupling problem effectively between speed and tension. Simulation results are given for verification.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: We have proposed a novel variable-field toroidal-windings machine (VFToM) in order to overcome drawbacks such as the incompatibility between miniaturization and high efficiency. The machine is characterized by its structure that uses a three-dimensional magnetic flux to increase the torque density and adds a variable-field function to decrease the electromagnetic loss. This study focuses on improving the torque density and electromagnetic loss for the VFToM compared with a commercial traction motor. It is found that these characteristics can be improved using electromagnetic analysis. Therefore, we build a prototype of the machine based on the magnetic design. It is observed that the torque density cannot be improved by decreasing the maximum torque and the increasing the machine size. However, we can confirm an increase in the torque and decrease in the loss at high rotation speeds.

Abstract: The Unit Power Factor (UPF) operation of interior Permanent Magnet Synchronous Generator (IPMSG)-rectifier system is discussed in detail. The scheme is focus on the control of the classical architecture of IPMSG-Voltage source rectifier(VSR) which is widely used in All-Electric Ship. And the unit power factor control is applied to the generator-side converter by a reasonable allocation of d- and q-axis current. Based on detail modeling and discussion of the current track for UPF operation of VSR, the nature of UPF is revealed and the constraint conditions of satisfying power factor adjustable requirements are given. The relationship between the field weakening control and the UPF control is also discussed in this paper. Simulation and experimental studies are presented to illustrate the feasibility of the proposed method.

Abstract: A segment control scheme of inductive power transfer (IPT) system for rail transit is proposed in this paper. In this scheme, the power supply range of primary coils along the track is segmented into several intervals and the several sets of pickups are installed aboard. When the vehicle runs, the switching frequency and the reference current of inverters is modulated with the position of the pickup coils by loop-closed control of output voltage. A 750V IPT prototype has been built in our Lab. The validity of the segment control scheme is verified by the experiment results of resistive load and powering the vehicle.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In order to improve the reliability of Switched Reluctance drive system, this paper presents a new control method to reduce the capacitance value of DC bus. Firstly, based on the equivalent mathematical model of the electrolytic capacitor, the capacitance value of the DC bus is estimated at the fixed frequency. Three methods are proposed to reduce the capacitance of the bus, and the mathematical relationship between the maximum value of the DC link current and the minimum capacitance value is established. A switching cycle is divided into two sections: the commutation region and the non-commutation region. The switching modes in different regions are analyzed, and the feasibility of the method is verified by simulation. In the end, the traditional control strategy and bus peak current control strategy are compared. Research results show that : BPC can reduce the capacitance value of 60% without affecting the efficiency of the system.

Abstract: In this paper, a control strategy for open winding PMSM system collaboratively supplied by the bidirectional Z-source and voltage source converters is proposed. The modified SVPWM for bidirectional Z-source inverter and the zero-sequence current circuit is analyzed in this open winding PMSM system. A strategy of zero-sequence current suppression is employed and the space vectors of converters on both sides are redistributed. The control system with a bidirectional Z-source inverter can work in both motoring and generating modes, and with a flexible dc bus voltage on one side, the phase voltage of PMSM can achieve a boost and the motor can operate in a larger range of speed. The availability of the proposed control strategy is validated by the simulation of MATLAB/Simulink based on the 10kW open winding PMSM system.

Abstract: Degradation of arresters is most commonly maintained by measuring electric current leakage. Abstract: A Model Predictive Control (MPC) method is proposed for cascaded bi-directional DC-DC converter in this paper. Building the predictive models and minimizing the cost function are included in this method. Predictive values of state variables can be obtained according to the predictive models, which include the first chopper inductor current and the second chopper inductor current, etc. The cost function is based on the system requirements, and the switching state which minimizes the cost function is selected to be the control signal in the following sampling period. Abstract: Contactless transformer is the key part of the inductive power transfer (IPT) system that can realize safe electric-energy supply for mobile devices. This paper proposes a novel contactless transformer structure with trapezoidal magnet core, which can be applied to movable vehicle such as high-speed maglev vehicle IPT system. The inductances of primary and secondary windings of different core structures is analyzed by 3D finite element methods (FEM), and compared with that of traditional contactless transformer. Authors: A. Tanaka; S. Yamamoto; T. Ara; K. Sakai; S. Komuro
Author Affiliations: Graduate School of Science and Engineering, Toyo University, Japan; Faculty of Human Resources Development, Polytechnic University, Japan; Faculty of Human Resources Development, Polytechnic University, Japan; Graduate School of Science and Engineering, Toyo University, Japan; Graduate School of Science and Engineering, Toyo University, Japan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper presents a practical method to estimate the abnormal field voltage occurrence condition (AFVOC) at asynchronization for synchronous generator (SG) with a brushless excitation having a diode rectifier circuit in the rotational part of the SG. A simulation model to calculate the field transient current at asynchronization to the power bus system is shown. The AFVOC is estimated by simulating the field current at asynchronization and searching the condition (i.e., armature voltage and its phase differences) when the field current becomes negative. The proposed method is implemented on a 10kVA salient-type lamination-pole SG with pseudo external diode rectifier circuit connected to the field winding terminals. With simulation and experimental results, the validity of the proposed method is verified.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In order to improve the system efficiency and the battery life of electric vehicle in low speed condition, the maximum torque per ampere(MTPA) control strategy is used in vector control system of induction motor. The MTPA is a kind of variable excitation control strategy essentially, which worsens the torque dynamic performance seriously because of the existence of rotor time constant. In this paper, a novel MTPA control strategy of induction motor based on torque current compensation is proposed, which realizes the maximum torque-current ratio and also improves the torque response extraordinarily during the rotor flux linkage transient process. At the end of the paper, the experiment is performed to verify its practicability.

Document Title: A zero current commutation model predictive control method for the induction motor drive system fed by indirect matrix converter
Authors: Y. Mei; S. Wang
Author Affiliations: Collaborative Innovation Center of Electric Vehicles in Beijing, North China University of Technology, Beijing, China; Collaborative Innovation Center of Electric Vehicles in Beijing, North China University of Technology, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In order to simplify the commutation in the virtual rectifier, a zero current commutation model predictive control (ZCC-MPC) method is proposed for the induction motor drive system fed by indirect matrix converter (IMC). Switching states combination is adopted in the virtual inverter instead of single predictive switching state, which ensures that the inverter stage keeps at zero voltage vectors during the whole commutation procedure between bi-directional switches in the rectifier stage. Simulation results show that the drive system has good steady-state/ dynamic performances and the dc bus current is zero during switching actions of the rectifier. As a result, two-step dead-time commutation can be used for the virtual rectifier stage instead of the conventional four-step commutation method, which improves the safety, reliability and performances for the indirect matrix converter.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: To reduce energy consumption, a novel motor system is proposed using two individual current control technologies involving a multiphase inverter. The multiphase inverter technology comprises two sets of 3-phase windings connecting two 3-phase inverters. Each set of coils connecting the 3-phase inverters forms a rotating field. Two windings allow the resultant field to generate a rotating field of eight or four poles. Motor systems capable of changing their poles and phases are more efficient over a wider range of speeds. Results from simulations confirmed that the phase change of a motor using such controls yields a difference in torque-slip characteristics and a 28% reduction in torque ripple.

And it can be applied to a high voltage and high power convertor with less distorted output by multi-level waveforms. it can be expected to apply for the mega solar system. The feature of the system is that output voltage becomes multilevel waveform for low distortion and the circuit has an energy storage system such as a battery or an super capacitor to compensate surplus or shortage power between input and output and oscillation of capacitor voltage. In order to find out the mutual inductance characteristics, the different kinds of coil structures were analyzed. Aim at the inductive wireless charging system, the structure of the primary coil is changed to improve the coupling performance of the system and the number of the primary coils is increased into two or three. Conventionally, two methods are proposed for this problem. However, these methods need the data about the measured distortion or some customized servo controllers. Abstract: Wayside energy storage systems (ESSs) in DC-electrified railway are recently studied as one of methods to save regenerative brake energy. Voltage basis control method to regulate the filter capacitor (FC) voltage in order to increase the assisting and absorbing power was developed. The voltage controller gain in this method should be set high for more energy-saving effect. However, it causes sometimes an oscillation of FC voltage. A method to design controller gain considering the trade-off between energy-saving effect and anti-oscillation of FC voltage is proposed in this paper.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The DC microgrid is a kind of development trend, and it can obviously improve the power quality and efficiency compared with adding the DCAC and ACDC converters for the dc loads. In the DC microgrid, the dc bus voltage can be affected by many factors, such as the variation of grid power, the fluctuations of the distributed generators (DG) and the multiform storage devices. All of the plug and play equipment can result in the imbalance power in the dc bus and these power deduces the voltage fluctuations. In another situation, the dc bus voltage also leads to some fluctuations when the DC microgrid state changes from the on-grid state to the off-grid state. In order to improve the transient performance of the dc bus voltage, this paper analyzes the power transforms in the situation of the load plug state, the state changing from on-gird to off-grid, the state of the other DG, and proposes the dc bus voltage control strategy which incorporates the optimum operation method of all units in the system. The simulation result shows the proposed control method can effectively improve the dc bus voltage dynamic performance.
