Document Title: Comparison of nested-loop rotors in brushless doubly-fed induction machines
Authors: X. Wang; D. Liu; H. Polinder; D. Lahaye; J. A. Ferreira
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Sustainable Energy, Delft University of Technology, Mekelweg 4, 2628 CD, Delft, the Netherlands; Department of Electrical Sustainable Energy, Delft University of Technology, Mekelweg 4, 2628 CD, Delft, the Netherlands; Department of Electrical Sustainable Energy, Delft University of Technology, Mekelweg 4, 2628 CD, Delft, the Netherlands; Delft Institute of Applied Mathematics, Delft University of Technology, Mekelweg 4, 2628 CD, Delft, the Netherlands; Department of Electrical Sustainable Energy, Delft University of Technology, Mekelweg 4, 2628 CD, Delft, the Netherlands
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The brushless doubly-fed induction machine (DFIM) has great potential as a variable-speed generator for wind turbine applications. This special machine has a richer space-harmonic spectrum due to its special nested-loop rotor construction compared with conventional induction machines. It may result in higher iron losses, higher torque ripple and more time-harmonics adding to the grid total harmonic distortion (THD). This paper applies the 2D finite element (FE) model to investigate several different nested-loop rotor constructions. It shows the outer loop makes more contribution to the torque while the inner loop plays a small role in the torque production. The most outer loop determines the overall THD level while the inner one has little influence on it. The THD could be reduced by increasing the number of the outer loops. More machine performances could be studied to derive more guidelines for designing the middle loops.
Author Keywords: brushless;doubly-fed;induction machine;nested-loop rotor

Author Affiliations: Electrical engineering, College of Automation Engineering, Nanjing University of Aeronautics & Astronautics, China; Electrical engineering, College of Automation Engineering, Nanjing University of Aeronautics & Astronautics, China; Electrical engineering, College of Automation Engineering, Nanjing University of Aeronautics & Astronautics, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper proposes a novel control strategy for electrolytic capacitor-less quasi-Z-source inverter, which fed adjustable-speed drive (ASD) system with almost unit input power factor. The system has no shoot through issues and gains high reliability. By using E-caps-less topology, the life time can be greatly increased. In order to guarantee the high power factor and the ability of resisting grid voltage sags, the voltage and current double closed loop structure is used to control the QZSI. Choose PMSM driving system as the control object, a new control strategy is adopted to improve the power factor further. The effectiveness of the proposed system has been verified by simulation.

Abstract: To improve disturbance rejection ability of permanent magnet synchronous motor (PMSM) system, a novel sliding-mode reaching law is proposed in this paper. Document Title: Study for electromagnetic inference under construction in boosting transformer feeding system
Authors: Y. Tanaka; M. Ishikawa; K. Kurogi
Author Affiliations: East Japan Railway Company, Japan; East Japan Railway Company, Japan; East Japan Railway Company, Japan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In the area of Tohoku Japan, Boosting Transformer (BT) feeding system is widely used at the main conventional railway lines such as Tohoku line. In general, BT feeding system consists of two aerial wires, Overhead Contact line (OC) and Negative Feeder (NF). NF has the role of denying the inductive obstacles which are occurred from OC. Typically, under construction (ex. station reform, over bridge construction), NF have to be replaced for ground cable temporarily by construct obstruction. It is necessary to consider influences of inductive obstacles for the lines of communication before NF moving establishment. Therefore, the purpose of this paper is to examine the phenomena of inductive obstacles from replaced NF by measuring the voltage of communication cable. In this paper, we show a calculation result of the inductive voltage influences by the replaced NF, and we define clearly effective measures of future construct plans.

Document Title: Transient analysis of brushless doubly-fed induction generator
Authors: G. Liu; X. Wang; F. Xiong
Author Affiliations: Hubei Collaborative Innovation Center for High-Efficiency Utilization of Solar Energy, Hubei University of Technology, China; School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China; School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Short circuit property of electrical machine is an important performance indicator. In term of short circuit analysis method of traditional induction machine, compared with the calculation process of doubly fed machine, the short circuit characteristics of brushless doubly-fed induction generator (BDFIG) has been presented in this paper. At first, the transient equations were deduced in the form of space vector, and the dynastic equivalent circuit was given. Then, the current characteristics of BDFIG at the generator mode when three symmetrical short circuit occurred at the terminators of power windings was analyzed. Finally, the simulated results of a 700 kW prototype machine was accommodated, and the simulation confirm the validity of calculating method.

Authors: Q. Wang; N. Yamamura; M. Ishida

Abstract: In the micro-grid, renewable energy is used as power generations and source voltage fluctuated. So we proposed to use Matrix Converters (MCs) which have voltage control ability instead of transformers to supply a certain amount of power for the consumer sides <sup>[1]</sup>. To suppress the fluctuation of the amplitude of the source voltage, we had proposed a load voltage control method for the MCs <sup>[2] [3]</sup>. And a PLL has been used to suppress the fluctuation of the source frequency.<sup>[4]-[7]</sup> However, PLL uses a PI control and time delay occurred. To improve the quality of the load voltages, an instantaneous control method is needed. In this paper, we proposed a constant output frequency control method which doesn't cause any time delay by taking advantage of the control function of our MCs and verified the effectiveness by simulations and experiments.

Abstract: In the inner evaporative cooling system of turbo-generator stator, the forced circulation mode is utilized and the pump was chosen as the driving force, for the biggish flow resistance of cooling fluid inside the hollow conductors of horizontal arrangement. In this cooling system, the flow and heat transfer characteristics of the two-phase cooling fluid inside the hollow conductors play an important role to the operation and cooling effects of system. In this paper, the flow resistance of cooling fluid and the temperature distribution of hollow conductor were analyzed deeply through the simulation and experiment. The simulation results of wall temperature of hollow conductors were compared with the experimental results and it was shown that the prediction accuracy of simulating is satisfying. The influences of the lengths of saturated and subcooled boiling on the heat transfer performance of system were discussed.

Abstract: In this paper, a sensorless control method of surface-mounted permanent-magnet synchronous motors (SPMSM) based on an adaptive sliding mode observer (SMO) is proposed. In the adaptive SMO system, the error between the actual current and the estimated current is fed to a PI controller for extracting rotor speed and position. Comparing with the conventional SMO, the low pass filter (LPF) and the additional rotor position compensation are omitted in the proposed algorithm. And the estimated performance in the adaptive SMO is improved. The stability of the adaptive SMO is verified by the Lyapunov function. The simulation results show the validity of the proposed algorithm.

Secondly, the expression of electromagnetic torque is deduced by a basic magnetic circuit model. Then, the basic characteristic of the proposed motor is analyzed by 3D finite element method (3D-FEM), such as back electrodynamic force (back EMF) and cogging torque. Abstract: An efficiency optimization control strategy of the direct torque controlled interior permanent magnet synchronous motors is proposed. Firstly, the mathematical model of the IPMSM is established in the rotor frame considering iron losses. Secondly, the function relationship between the power losses and the output torque, speed and stator flux is analyzed, and the computational formula of the stator flux amplitude which makes the power losses minimization is derived under different operating conditions. Consequently, the efficiency optimization control for direct torque controlled IPMSM driving systems is achieved. The experimental results show that the proposed control method not only preserves the fast torque dynamic response of the conventional direct torque control, but also improves operating efficiency of the driving system.

Abstract: A pattern matching method for position sensorless control of IPMSM with heavy magnetic saturation in standstill and very low speed region has been proposed. The rotor position is estimated by comparing the feature values measured in a real-time with in beforehand. To measure feature values, high frequency signal must be injected. The operation region of pattern matching method is limited by amplitude of injectable signal. This paper presents the operating region that could utilize pattern matching method. Also to expand the operating region, a new signal injection method and matching method are proposed. By using the proposed method, the same sampling time interval for measuring feature values could be obtained even smaller signal is injected.

Abstract: The rotating high-frequency voltage injection is a method of the sensorless field oriented control of permanent magnet synchronous motor. The characteristic harmonic elimination method is introduced to replace the low pass filters, and the error brought by the stator resistance and the band-pass filters is compensated. Authors: J. Wang; J. Wu; C. Gan; Q. Sun

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Proper flux-weakening (FW) strategy has to be adopted to achieve wide-speed operation of permanent magnet synchronous motor (PMSM). Two flux-weakening methods based on current vector control are investigated in this paper. One is a feedforward method, which is based on the mathematical model of PMSM and requires the motor parameters. The other is a feedback method, which employs a PI compensator to regulate the demagnetizing current reference. To verify and compare the two FW methods, a vector control system for PMSM is developed. The simulation results clarify that both two FW methods extend the constant power region of PMSM effectively, while the feedforward method can generate larger torque in high speed region and provide wider constant power region. Furthermore, comparative investigation of the two FW methods, traditional maximum torque per ampere (MTPA) control and id = 0 control is also carried out.

Abstract: Lithium batteries are widely used in electric vehicles and renewable energy systems. The battery packs are very expensive, while the performances and life time both depend on the characteristics of the charging/discharging circuits and the equalization circuits. Based on bi-directional Buck-boost converter, this paper presents a new converter topology integrating the battery charging/discharging circuit and battery balancing circuit. Compared to traditional circuits, it uses fewer switching devices, simple structure, less power consumption and easy to implement. For battery packs with high capacity and large voltage differences, it can achieve high-current and fast balancing performances during the static and charging period. In addition, this paper describes in detail how to select charging/discharging inductors, balanced inductors and filter capacitors. Simulation results show the effectiveness of the new circuit.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper proposes a new control system for Adjustable-speed pumped-storage generator (ASG) to decrease frequency fluctuations of power system with a large amount of wind farm introduced. In recent years, environmental problems are becoming serious and wind power generation has been attracting much attention and introduced throughout the world due to its low environmental impacts. However, wind power generation is an unstable power source with fluctuating output due to wind speed variations. Thus, when a large amount of wind power generation is connected to the power system, it can decrease power quality, e.g., frequency variations. There are some methods to suppress the frequency fluctuation in the power system, among which ASG can be an effective countermeasure. However, there has not been sufficient report on the frequency control by using ASG. This paper proposes a new output control system for ASG to smooth fluctuating power of the wind farm (WF) which is based on information of the frequency fluctuations of the power system. It is shown by simulation analyses that the proposed ASG can decrease the frequency fluctuations more than the conventional Fixed-Speed Pumped-Storage Generator (FSG).

Document Title: Time- and spatial-harmonic content in synchronous electrical machines
Authors: B. Hannon; P. Sergeant; L. Dupre
Author Affiliations: Dept. EESA, Electrical Energy Laboratory, Ghent University, V. Vaerwyckweg 1, 9000 Gent, Belgium; Dept. EESA, Electrical Energy Laboratory, Ghent University, V. Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The use of power electronics has led to a growing importance of higher time-harmonic content in electrical machines. To gain insight in phenomena related to these higher harmonics, such as noise and losses, a good understanding of the magnetic field's harmonic content is mandatory. Moreover, the development of highly-accurate analytical models requires a qualitative knowledge of the machine's harmonic content. Therefore this work aims at studying the harmonic content of synchronous electrical machines. To do so the three aspects that determine the harmonic content of the machine's magnetic field are discussed: the excitation source, the stator-current density and the geometry. Based on that discussion, general expressions for the time- and spatial-harmonic combinations are formulated. These expressions are proven to be valid for a very broad range of synchronous machines.

Abstract: This paper presents Model predictive control technique for the high efficiency with reduced switches stresses T-type three-level Neutral Point Clamped (NPC) inverter for Photovoltaic (PV) applications. T-type three-level NPC inverter is a combination of the NPC and T-Type inverters. As it is a combination of T-type and NPC it has the same features of NPC such as breakdown voltage of the switching devices are half of the DC link voltage, so it has less switching losses. And at the same time it has the same feature of the T-type which is less conduction losses. Model Predictive Control (MPC) regulates the T-type 3L-NPC inverter to do the following functions: extract maximum power from PV, ensure voltage balance of the splatted capacitor and inject a sinusoidal current in phase with the grid voltage.

Abstract: A radial composite ultrasonic motor is proposed in this paper. The configuration and the working principle of the motor are presented. Finite element model of the stator is developed and the dynamics of the stator are simulated based on modal analysis and harmonic analysis. A prototype of the stator is fabricated. The impedance-frequency characteristic and the radial vibration amplitude stimulated by the applied voltage are measured with impedance analyzer and laser Doppler velocimeter, respectively. Good agreements between the simulation results and the experimental results are obtained. Finally, a prototype of the radial composite ultrasonic motor is fabricated and tested, and the design idea of the proposed motor is validated by test results.

Abstract: A novel E-core transverse flux-flux reversal linear motor is investigated in this paper. The magnets are mounted on the primary teeth with alternating polarities. The problem of complex structure of transverse flux motors is addressed. At first, the basic structure and operating principle are introduced. Then, the equation of thrust is calculated based on the equivalent magnetic circuit method. Authors: J. Itoh; T. Masuda; T. Nagano; H. Higa
Author Affiliations: Nagaoka University of Technology, Niigata, Japan; Nagaoka University of Technology, Niigata, Japan; Nagaoka University of Technology, Niigata, Japan; Nagaoka University of Technology, Niigata, Japan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper presents a hybrid six-step operation, which utilizes both a pulse width modulation (PWM) and a conventional six-step operation of a matrix converter in order to reduce switching losses during the standby time of flywheel. In the hybrid six-step operation, a virtual AC-DC-AC conversion is applied in order to separate the control of the matrix converter into a current source rectifier (CSR) control and a voltage source inverter (VSI) control. In particular, CSR is operated in PWM and VSI is operated in the six-step operation mode. Consequently, the switching loss of VSI is reduced as compared with the PWM operation due to the conventional six-step operation mode. In addition, the input current total harmonic distortion (THD) is improved as compared with the conventional six-step operation because the CSR modulation is PWM. In the experimental result, the input current THD of the hybrid six-step operation is improved by 76.0 % compared to the conventional six-step operation. Moreover, the efficiency of hybrid six-step operation was 1.0 % lower than the conventional six-step operation. In the hybrid the six-step operation, the input current THD is improved by 76.0 % in exchange for the drops of efficiency by 1.0 %.
Author Keywords: Flywheel energy storage system (FESS);matrix converter;six-step operation;pulse width modulation (PWM)

Abstract: Voltage and torque ripples degrade the control precision and increase vibration and noise in electric vehicles, servo systems, and wind generators. The ripple in the back EMF, which was significant in the conventional winding configuration, was reduced to below 1% of the fundamental in the proposed winding scheme. Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In order to achieve a higher dynamic response and better disturbance rejection performance, an adaptive speed control method for PMSM is proposed in this paper. This speed regulation scheme is composed of current predictive control (CPC) in current loop and extended state observer (ESO) in speed loop. Unlike the proportional-integral (PI) control with time delay caused by the integration part, CPC can obtain stator reference voltages directly. The ESO can estimate both the states variation and disturbances simultaneously to form a feedforward compensation which can reduce the impact caused by them. To verify the control performance of the proposed method, a traditional PI control method under the same condition is used for comparison. Matlab simulation and experimental results validate the advantages of the proposed control method on both dynamic response performance and capacity of resisting disturbance.

Abstract: Hall-effect sensors are wildly utilized to estimate rotor angle of permanent magnet synchronous motor (PMSM) in low-cost situations using vector control. A variety of estimation algorithms have been proposed to improve the precision of the estimated rotor position, while few literatures so far dedicate in dealing with Hall-effect sensor faults. In this paper, the types of sensor faults are divided into three kinds according to the number of faulted sensors. Here, the amount and position of faulted elements are identified based on the output signals, with improved orthogonal Phase Locked Loop. Single and double sensor faults in this case are analyzed, and corresponding solutions are also present to guarantee the continuous operation of PMSM within a certain period. The simulations based on MATLAB/Simulation are established with speed and load changing and the results show a nice fault-tolerant performance. Furthermore, the limitations of strategies are discussed in the end.

Abstract: A novel position/speed sensorless vector control approach which is capable of not only driving Induction Motors (IMs), damperless surface/interior Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motors (PMSMs) and PMSMs with damper winding but also tuning all electrical motor parameters used for their sensorless control system design by a unified method is discussed. This approach is tentatively named the Universal Sensorless Vector (USV) control. In this paper a simple electrical motor parameter tuning method for the USV control by means of a Pulse Width Modulation (PWM) inverter. Abstract: This paper presents a discontinuous carrier-based space vector pulsewidth modulation (CB-SVPWM) strategy for three-phase voltage source inverter (VSI) fed asymmetrical two-phase induction motor (TPIM) drives. The proposed modulation technique is based on the general equation of the zero-sequence voltage injection signal in the modulation signals for the drive's TPIM scheme. This technique enables to reduce the average switching losses of the power devices and improve the performance of the TPIM. The viability and performance of the proposed modulation strategy is verified through both simulation and experimental results, which are demonstrated to provide the capability and stability of the proposed system.

Abstract: This paper deals with short-circuit accident of three 10 MW class superconducting wind turbine generators; a salient pole type superconducting generator (S-SCG), a non-salient pole type superconducting generator (NS-SCG), and a fully superconducting generator (FSCG). Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: BLDC motors are often used for high speed applications, for example in pumps, ventilators and refrigerators. For commutation discrete position information is necessary. This feedback is often provided by Hall sensors instead of more expensive encoders. However, even small misalignment of the Hall sensors in low cost BLDC motors can lead to unwanted torque ripples or reduced performance of BLDC motors. This misplacement leads not only to noise and vibrations caused by the torque ripples but also to lower efficiency. In this paper, a self-sensing technique to assess the misalignment is introduced. The objective is to obtain knowledge of the quality of the commutation by quantifying the misalignment. The method used in this paper is based on the fundamental components of voltage and current measurements and only needs the available current and voltage signals and electrical parameters such as resistance and inductance to estimate the misalignment.

Abstract: Large high-voltage induction motors are widely used in industrial applications. In this paper, the starting time is accurately evaluated from a newly proposed technique that is employed to estimate electrical torque curve of induction motors from their manufacturer technical data. Document Title: A hierarchical control strategy for cascaded H-bridge multilevel static synchronous series compensator
Authors: B. Pan; H. Yu; K. Li; Z. Zhao; Y. Jiang; L. Yuan
Author Affiliations: State Grid Smart Grid Research Institute, Beijing 102209, China; State Grid Smart Grid Research Institute, Beijing 102209, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing 100084, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing 100084, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing 100084, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing 100084, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Static synchronous series compensator (SSSC) based on the cascaded H-bridge multilevel converter is used as the power flow controller by injecting controllable sinusoidal voltage into the high voltage AC transmission lines. After analyzing the basic working principle of the cascaded H-bridge multilevel SSSC, a hierarchical control strategy with multiple control loops is proposed in this paper. At the system level, the constant impedance compensation scheme is adopted, which generates the reactive voltage reference for the converter. At the converter level, the double-loop control with the outer capacitor voltage loop and the inner inductor current loop is used. For the capacitor voltage balancing scheme designed for the active power balance, the overall balance and the individual balance are enough for the star-configured cascaded H-bridge converter. According to the whole set of control strategy, the voltage reference for each H-bridge cell can be generated. Then carrier phase shift modulation is used to generate the control signals for each cells. This proposed hierarchical control strategy is simple and very easy to be realized. Simulation results based on a 220 kV two-terminal grid with a 12.6 MVA three-phase SSSC have confirmed the feasibility and effectiveness of the control strategy.

Abstract: This study suggests a position estimator using linear hall effect sensors and iterative algorithm. Compared to other typical position sensors such as encoders and resolvers, hall effect sensors have several advantages. (e.g., insensitivity to both external disturbances and environmental contaminations, and having a scaleless property). Furthermore, linear hall sensors provide more detailed information on the motor position (i.e., finer resolution) than that of square wave hall sensors. Using those characteristics, a position estimator with linear hall sensors is proposed. Considering the sinusoidal property of the magnetic flux distribution along the position of the motor system, an iterative algorithm with dual sampling rates is applied. The effectiveness of the suggested method was validated with a simulation.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Five-level neutral point clamped H-bridge (NPCH) converter has been found practical application due to its low EMI and high output capacity. However, the unbalanced loss distribution of semiconductor devices in NPCH converter would limit the lifetime and the output capacity. In this paper, a five-level active neutral point clamped H-bridge (ANPCH) converter topology is studied, which is composed two three-level active neutral point clamped phase legs with H-bridge connection. Compared with the conventional NPCH, the ANPCH topology has more redundant switching states. The operation principle and loss distribution of every switching pattern are described in detail, and a loss-balancing control scheme is presented. Simulation and experimental results show that the loss distribution can be well balanced in ANPCH converter, resulting that the output power can be substantially increased or the total harmonic distortion of output current would be reduced effectively.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The paper firstly points out that there are bifurcations on both slow scale and fast scale in Dual Boost PFC in mode of average current control. In terms of slow-scale bifurcation, the nonlinear model of the circuit is derived based on the state space averaging method. The different slow-scale bifurcation behaviors were predicted by the numerical calculation. The further analysis shows there are different bifurcation points in Dual Boost PFC with constant resistance load and constant power load. Secondly, iterative mapping model are derived to describe the nonlinear dynamics of a average-current-control DB PFC converter in a continuous mode. This model is used to examine the fast-scale double-period bifurcation problem around peak within a line cycle. Based on the analysis of the characteristic value of the Jacobian matrix, the bifurcation point of the circuit with the change of the output capacitance is predicted. Finally, the experimental verifies the calculation result.

Abstract: Simple, robust construction of reluctance machine and simpler control needed for them have reignited interest in these machines. The constructional modifications and new configuration such as brushless doubly fed reluctance machines (BDFRM) show superior performance compared to traditional counterpart especially in variable speed applications such as pumps, wind generation etc. Design of BDFRM is different than other machines, as there is unusual pole combinations of stator and rotor and at the same time there is no winding on rotor. The operation and performance of the machine greatly depends on modulation between stator windings and rotor with provision of improved saliency. This paper examines a few critical issues in design of BDFRM and optimization in design process. Abstract: In the multi-degree-of-freedom high precision positioning systems, high positioning accuracy can be not achieved only with long-stroke motors. The proposed planar motor with a millimeter range of movement can be used as a precision compensation actuator for long-stroke motors due to its high positioning accuracy, high force resolution, high structural strength and low force ripples. This paper deals with the static characteristic analysis and force optimization of the 3-DOF short-stroke planar motor. First, the operation principle and structure of this planar motor are introduced. Second, the accurate air-gap flux density distribution is obtained analytically and the specific force expression is derived using numerical integration method. Third, the analytical static characteristics are verified by the experimental measurements. Finally, the trend of force, force density and acceleration versus the magnet height and the pole pitch are obtained, which provide the basis and criterion for motor design.

Abstract: Owing to the limitation of the switching losses and heat elimination, the maximum switching frequency of the high power motor drive system is generally lower. In addition, the fundamental voltage of the inverter can be effectively improved with overmodulation algorithm. However, the classical overmodulation algorithm for space vector pulse width modulation (SVPWM) needs to store a lot of data in advance and the control precision is not perfect. Considering the above two reasons, this paper presents the synchronized SVPWM strategy in the overmodulation region using superposition principle. Consequently, the equivalent carrier-based modulated functions of the strategies in the overmodulation mode I and II are derived respectively based on the regular sampling rules of carrier-based pulse width modulation. Experimental results illustrate the validity and effectiveness of the algorithm.

Abstract: This paper investigates the effectiveness of virtual synchronous machine based on three-phase voltage source converter. The virtual machine can effectively slow down frequency dynamics in micro-grid, which is achieved by emulating the damping and inertia of synchronous machine. Besides, the theoretical analysis indicates the virtual synchronous machine is closely related to the conventional droop control, and their performances are compared and discussed. Nevertheless, both controls may lead to micro-grid frequency deviated from the nominal value, so this study also takes the frequency restoration into consideration. To achieve the fault-tolerant performance, a new fault-tolerant control strategy based on the open-circuit fault analysis and processing method is proposed and investigated. Abstract: Power converter open-circuit fault leads to reduction of motor output performance. Fault-tolerant control strategy, which is applied to power converter of four-phase doubly salient electro-magnetic motor (DSEM) drive, is investigated in this paper to improve the post-fault motor performance. A fault-tolerant topology is newly presented. It has the advantage of simple structure with only two bidirectional switches added to four-phase full bridge converter. Based on the presented topology, fault-tolerant control process contains four steps, including fault detection, faulty arm isolation, bidirectional switch triggering and switching states adjustment. The proposed fault-tolerant control strategy is able to obtain the average output torque nearly as that of normal operation, which is proved by the co-simulation results of Maxwell and Simplorer. Finally, experimental results demonstrate the correctness and feasibility of the proposed fault-tolerant control strategy.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The commutation processes in uncontrolled diode rectifiers have been extensively studied and modelled. However, in some applications, such as electrical power generation, the effects of these processes are often neglected. In low to medium rated, field wound, synchronous generators, the excitation system makes up a significant percentage of the whole generating set. Thus, the voltage drop due to the diode commutations can be quite significant. It is therefore of critical importance that these are considered during all the design stages of the brushless excitation system of synchronous generators. In this paper, a detailed analysis of the commutation aspects related to the diode rectifier of a brushless exciter of a 400kVA synchronous generator is presented and an accurate voltage drop prediction model is proposed and validated.

However, in this case, there will be arisen a certain issue that we have to bridge over. It is just the problem that gap sensors will block the way in the production line. Realization of magnetic levitation system without using the gap sensors is our dream. In general, magnetic levitation is not so easy even for a usual iron body in case of no gap sensor. Document Title: A study on total loss reduction in motor drive systems based on flying capacitor multilevel inverter
Authors: S. Mochidate; K. Matsuo; H. Obara; Y. Sato
Author Affiliations: Chiba University, 1-33, Yayoi-cho, Inageku, Chiba-shi, Chiba, Japan 263-8522, (Japan); Chiba University, 1-33, Yayoi-cho, Inageku, Chiba-shi, Chiba, Japan 263-8522, (Japan); Yokohama National University, 79-1, Tokiwadai, Hodogayaku, Yokohama-shi, Kanagawa, Japan 240-8501, (Japan); Chiba University, 1-33, Yayoi-cho, Inageku, Chiba-shi, Chiba, Japan 263-8522, (Japan)
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Multilevel converters can generate the multilevel output voltage using internal voltage sources. Thus, they can reduce harmonics and EMI. From the practical point of view, implementation of the source of multilevel voltage without increase in the volume of the converters is strongly desired. In this context, the flying capacitor multilevel converters are most promising candidates for the practical multilevel converters. AC motor drive is one of typical applications of inverters. In this case, the additional losses caused by the harmonics in the inverter outputs often become practical problems. As a solution to these problems, the multilevel inverters are expected to reduce the harmonic losses. As the number of output levels in the multilevel inverters increases, the harmonics of the output current further decrease. However, the losses in the inverter may increase due to the number of the circuit components in the paths of the main currents will increase. In this paper, as a guideline to minimize the total losses of the multilevel inverters and the motors, we investigate the loss components in the flying capacitor multilevel inverters and induction motors for several different number of the output levels under various operating conditions.
Author Keywords: Multi-level inverter;Flying capacitor;Harmonics;AC motor drive

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In indirectly hydrogen cooled turbine generators used in high-efficiency combined cycle power plants, improving the energy efficiency and increasing the power density are required for one of the solutions of the global environmental problems. When the output current is increased for achieving the high power density, the stray load loss at the stator end region is increased by the leakage flux from the armature and field coils. Therefore, in the case that the stray load loss at the stator end region is increased when the output capacity is increased, it is necessary to evaluate the temperature under the condition of the leading power factor load. In this paper, we analyzed the loss density distribution at the end region structures using the large-scale 3D electromagnetic field analysis to establish the temperature reliability in the 870MVA indirectly hydrogen cooled machine, which is the largest class capacity in the world. Using the loss density distribution obtained by the analysis, the thermal analysis is then performed. The analysis results show good agreements with the measured values.

Abstract: Claw-pole type motor is known for its high inductance, saturation region and unique simple structure, which leads to nonlinear characteristic performance. Therefore, it is crucial to understand what effects design parameters has on motor performance. In this paper, 3-D FEM results are compared, when design parameters such as motor height, claw height, claw skew angle, coil turns and number of poles are changed. Abstract: In order to restrain the thrust fluctuation of permanent magnet synchronous linear motor (PMSLM), trapezoidal shaped permanent magnet (TSPM) has been proposed in this paper. Then the accuracy of analytical method is verified by finite element method. The analytical calculation agrees well with the finite element results. Finally, the experimental results indicate that the thrust fluctuation can be restrained effectively by the proposed method.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Position Sensorless control strategies based on back-EMF detection have been widely used in the high-speed permanent magnet motors with active magnetic bearings (AMBs). However, due to the rotor vibration, the air gap flux density of motors varies with different rotor position, which introduces the distortion of back-EMF detection. In order to reduce this blight, some researches have been conducted in this paper. Firstly, different kinds of rotor vibrations are analyzed, such as residual unbalance, torque ripple and etc. The vibration while rotor runs near the critical speed of rigid mode is hardly completely suppressed by active vibration control or dynamic balance. Secondly, the influence of rotor position estimation is analyzed. Hence, an improved rotor speed estimator composed of adaptive speed notch filter (ANF) instead of fixed frequency notch filters is proposed. The experimental results confirm the feasibility and effectiveness of the proposed method.

SOAC has a fixed structure and therefore, an incremental learning to adapt a novel environment is difficult. On the other hand, the SEAC has an evolving structure and therefore, incremental learning is very easy. In addition, the network structure tends to be smart. This is because the number of modules is one at first and the new module is increased as needed. Before now, simulation study regarding the SEAC has been proposed but there is no report dealing with using actual equipment. Authors: S. Sumita; Y. Iwaji
Author Affiliations: Hitachi, Ltd., 7-1-1, Omika Hitachi, Ibaraki, Japan; Hitachi, Ltd., 7-1-1, Omika Hitachi, Ibaraki, Japan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper presents a system for position sensorless control of a switched reluctance motor (SRM) that has mutual-inductance. The rotor position of an SRM is estimated by substituting a differential value of sampled current (differential current) into the motor model. The position estimation accuracy is dependent on the sensitivity of the differential current to the position. However, the sensitivity is affected by a combination of three-phase voltages in an SRM with mutual-inductance. The combination of three-phase voltage shifts in a pulse width modulation PWM period. Therefore, the proposed system adjusts the A/D sampling timing of the differential current in accordance with the combination of three-phase voltages in a PWM period. The adjustment of the A/D sampling timing increases the sensitivity of the differential current to the position and decreases the position estimation error. Results of a simulation and an experiment showed the effectiveness of the proposed system.

Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Sustainable Energy, Delft University of Technology, Mekelweg 4, 2628 CD, Delft, the Netherlands; Department of Electrical Sustainable Energy, Delft University of Technology, Mekelweg 4, 2628 CD, Delft, the Netherlands; Delft Institute of Applied Mathematics, Delft University of Technology, Mekelweg 4, 2628 CD, Delft, the Netherlands; Department of Electrical Sustainable Energy, Delft University of Technology, Mekelweg 4, 2628 CD, Delft, the Netherlands; Department of Electrical Sustainable Energy, Delft University of Technology, Mekelweg 4, 2628 CD, Delft, the Netherlands
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Permanent-magnet machines with fractional-slot concentrated windings are easy to manufacture. Their popularity therefore is steadily increasing. Without a proper design, however, the induced eddy-current losses in the solid rotor get rather high. The modeling and the prediction of eddy-current losses for these machines are thus very important during the design process. This paper focuses on the finite-element analysis and the experimental validation of eddy-current losses for this kind of machine with a small axial length. Two-dimensional and three-dimensional transient finite-element models are developed for computing the eddy-current losses. The rotor motion is taken into account using an Arbitrary Lagrangian-Eulerian formulation. The total iron losses are measured experimentally and a method to separate the rotor iron losses from the total iron losses is presented. The validation results show that the two-dimensional finite-element model overestimates the losses due to the end-effects being neglected. The three-dimensional model agrees much better with the measurements in both no-load and on-load operations.

Abstract: In this paper, a half bridge soft switching resonant converter for induction heating load with SiC MOSFET devices is proposed. In order to raise the efficiency of the proposed converter, a single phase half bridge resonant converter integrated with SiC MOSFET is used. All of the switching devices in the proposed converter achieve zero voltage switching (ZVS). Thus, the proposed circuit has a high efficiency characteristic due to low switching losses. Abstract: Acoustic noise and vibration caused by the radial forces of a switched reluctance motor (SRM) are a significant issue. This drawback is the main reason behind the lack of popularity of SRMs in practical applications. This study proposes a method for reducing the acoustic noise and vibration of a three-phase SRM. The proposed current waveform is selected to ensure a constant total radial force of the stator teeth while suppressing the third harmonic component that generates the acoustic noise. The effect of the proposed method is confirmed through high-switching-frequency operation with SiC MOSFETs.

Abstract: An axial flux permanent-magnet (AFPM) motor requires 3-dimensional (3-D) modeling and analysis in order to describe completely its 3-D behavior. Although the 3-D finite element analysis (FEA) provides accurate solution, its computational cost limits its use as a design tool. To address this problem, a 3-D field reconstruction method (FRM) is introduced as an alternative to the 3-D FEA. In this paper, an AFPM motor is designed and analyzed by using the 3-D FRM. The prototype does not have pole shoe on the teeth, thus it has high cogging torque due to high slot harmonics. Therefore, skewed PMs are employed on the rotor for cogging torque mitigation. This paper presents the improved 3-D FRM to take into account the magnet skew effect. To verify a validation of the proposed 3-D FRM, the analysis results are compared with the ones estimated by 3-D FEM.

Abstract: A novel soft-switching interleaved boost dc/dc converter is proposed in this paper. The proposed converter uses two boost dc/dc converters with interleaved operation to increase the output power and reduce the input ripple current and output ripple voltage. Comparison with conventional interleaved boost dc/dc converter, the proposed converter has not additional voltage stress on main switches. A soft-switching auxiliary circuit is configured in the presented dc/dc converter to provide the soft-switching function on main switches and auxiliary switches and improve the problem of switching losses and EMI. A prototype has been implemented in laboratory to verify circuit theory.

Abstract: The auxiliary resonant snubber inverter (ARSI) as a zero-voltage-transition (ZVT) inverter can achieve the soft-switching of the semiconductor switches, contributing to high efficiency. In the previous researches, the switching loss are considered to be zero with the zero-voltage switching (ZVS) and zero-current switching (ZCS) of the switches. However, the turn-off of the main switches and the turn-on of the auxiliary switches are pseudo ZVS and pseudo ZCS respectively, instead of true ZVS and true ZCS, resulting in non-zero switching loss. In this paper, the switching loss in the ARSI is analyzed, which is related to the resonant capacitors and inductor. Besides, the efficiency and loss of the ARSI are tested in the simulation and the experiment.

Authors: Y. Katamoto; H. Yamada; T. Tanaka; M. Okamoto; T. Yada

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper proposes a new cooperative-control strategy for a 400-W class light-emitting diode (LED) driver consisting of two DC/DC converters operating in the discontinuous current mode (DCM). In the cooperative control method, one DC/DC converter is selected to supply the output current for the LED, based on the reference value of the LED current. Thus, the proposed cooperative-control strategy achieves wide dimming range operation. The DCM operation improves the total harmonic distortion (THD) value at the ac side of the LED driver. The basic principle of the proposed control strategy is discussed, and is then confirmed by digital computer simulations. A prototype LED driver is constructed and tested. Experimental results demonstrate that a wide dimming operation range from 1% to 100% is achieved with a THD value less than 10% at the ac side, by the proposed control strategy.

Abstract: This paper presents the implementation of a Rogowski's coil for a special purpose on partial discharge detection. Abstract: Acoustic optimization and auralization of inverter-fed drive systems require system-simulation models for the machine's air-gap forces. This paper proposes such a model for three-phase squirrel-cage induction machines. Modeling the radial air-gap forces as spatial forces shapes allows for an computationally efficient implementation, provides descriptive results and interfaces well with numerical vibration synthesis procedures. Abstract: This paper presents the assessment of the vector control for a two-phase induction generator (TPIG) driven by a wind turbine simulator. The structure of this system consists of two sections. The first section is a wind turbine simulator using a dc motor drive performed by a torque control for providing mechanical power to TPIG. The second section is the three-leg voltage source inverter connected TPIG which is governed by the indirect vector control. This strategy offers the independent controls between flux and torque of TPIG and its improved performance by compensated stator currents. Matlab/Simulink software is applied to the proposed system under various conditions. The simulation results of dynamic response for the proposed vector control are commanded by the wind turbine simulator providing the torque-speed characteristics of a small wind turbine and conclude that TPIG can be used for wind energy applications.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Interior permanent magnet synchronous motors (IPMSMs) are controlled by either a rotor position sensor or a sensorless control method, which enables highly efficient operation. The voltage-current phase difference control method is a sensorless control method that offers low cost and a simple control system, which is based on V/f control. However, speed ripple occurs under a fluctuating load because the system does not consider speed, torque, or current feedback loops. This paper proposes a speed ripple reduction method in which the angular velocity of the inverter is compensated. Both simulation and experimental results demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method. This paper also shows that the proposed method is applicable to speed ripple reduction over a wide-operating range.

Abstract: A coordinated pitch and generator control strategy is presented in this paper in order to realize flexible power tracking of wind turbine. With the proposed method, the output power of wind turbine can be regulated flexibly by pitch control system and/or the generator control system according to the dispatch command, in order to ensure the steady-state power balance of the local grid and play an active role in terms of system frequency regulation; meanwhile, optimization targets like mechanical stress minimization can also be added into the coordinated control strategy to further limit the negative impact on the wind turbine itself. Abstract: Recently more and more attention has been paid to the application of flux weakening of a permanent magnet synchronous machine (PMSM). A new stator design with shunt teeth has been studied by magnetic circuit analysis and finite element analysis. The new design and the conventional design have been compared and discussed. The validity and feasibility of the new design with a high flux weakening capability were verified by analytical and experimental results. It is predicted that the constant power speed ratio (CPSR) was as high as 4:1. The presented stator configuration would be a better solution for PMSM achieving a wide constant power speed range.

Abstract: The control strategy for current regulator based on synchronous frame has been widely applied for the three-phase pulse width modulation (PWM) rectifier. However, because of the lack of one demention in mathematical model, delaying one-quarter of a periodic synchronization of the actual circuit physical quantities to achieve a group of virtual physical quantities orthographic with the actual ones for synchronous coordinate transformation have been proposed as the conventional approach for the case of the single-phase PWM rectifier. The method given above severely degrades the dynamic performance, and even leads to an instable system. A new method is introduced to solve these problems by constructing a virtual orthogonal circuit, and a novel current-loop controller based on complex vector, where there is no need of accurate inductance value, is also been used to solve the coupling issue coming up with the virtual orthogonal circuit. The simulation and experimental results verify the validity of the proposed method.

Abstract: When the high speed PMSM is driven by the PWM inverter, major ripple current will be introduced in the windings of the motor. The ripple current can significantly increase electromagnetic loss of the motor. Because the ripple current cannot be considered in the sine wave driving mode, the electromagnetic loss calculation has large deviation. In order to accurately calculate the electromagnetic loss, numerical co-analysis evaluation techniques is presented. Calculation and measurement results show that the presented co-analysis method can achieve good prediction for the electromagnetic loss of the high speed PMSM.

Abstract: This paper proposed a new structure of three-stage brushless synchronous starter/generator and its starting strategy. This paper researches the mathematical model of the new type of three-stage brushless synchronous starter/generator and prove the correctness of flux weaken scheme. A starting strategy is proposed and the starting process is divided into two stages-constant torque stage and constant power stage. Abstract: This paper investigates the radial suspension force of a bearingless permanent magnet motor with concentrated winding and discusses the generalization. Abstract: This paper proposes a new estimation method of the maximum torque ampere (MTPA) current phase at low-speed based on an “L<sub>d</sub>model”, which is a mathematical model that is robust to magnetic saturation for interior permanent magnet synchronous motors. In general, sensorless control techniques based on high frequency signal injection methods have been applied at low-speed drive. Those methods can guarantee the reasonable torque control performance even at zero speed. In addition, most of methods have robustness to motor parameter variation. However, the MTPA control in those methods requires q-axis inductance, which varies significantly owing to magnetic saturation. Therefore, a parameter mismatch may occur, which decreases motor efficiency and the operation range is narrowed. As mentioned above, we propose a position sensorless MTPA control method based on the L<sub>d</sub>model.

Abstract: Full-bridge half-controlled rectifier (FHR) of a 4-phase wound-field doubly salient generator (WFDSG) equipped with serial compensation capacitors (SCC) is researched in this paper. FHR can help to improve the power density of a WFDSG to a certain extent, however it augments the voltage regulation factor. To further enhance the power density and optimize external characteristic of the generating system, the FHR with serial compensation capacitors is proposed. On the basis of an 8/6 WFDSG prototype whose phase winding average inductance reaches 35mH, the working principles and modes of FHR with SCC are studied. The finite element analysis (FEA) is used to study the influences of SCC on FHR. Comparisons between FHRs without and with SCC in load condition are made. Furthermore, the output characteristics in different generating control strategies are analyzed by simulations. It is concluded that FHR with appropriate SCC can promote output power and decrease voltage regulation factor with the introduced control strategies.

Document Title: Design analysis of slit stator motors
Authors: Y. Yokoi; T. Higuchi
Author Affiliations: Division of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, Nagasaki University, 1-14 Bunkyo, Nagasaki 852-8521, Japan; Division of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, Nagasaki University, 1-14 Bunkyo, Nagasaki 852-8521, Japan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A design method of stator core structures is proposed to modify the component ratio of space harmonics in the magnetic field due to stator windings for torque enhancement and efficiency improvement. In fractional-slot concentrated winding configurations, the magnetic field due to the stator windings includes a specific space harmonic to be increased for drive torque and other dominant space harmonic to be reduced. In the proposed design, slit-like flux barriers are located in wound teeth for a 12-slot 10-pole machine. The stator slitting increases the driving space harmonic and reduces the other dominant space harmonic. The efficacy of this method is determined by deriving the winding factor and estimating the magnetic flux distribution and the motor performance through a finite-element method analysis.
Author Keywords: Air-gap flux density distribution;fractional-slot windings;stator slitting;winding factor
INSPEC Controlled Terms: finite element analysis;magnetic fields;magnetic flux;stators

Document Title: Analysis of a zero-voltage switching converter with high voltage gain and low current ripple
Authors: B. Lin; Z. Xie; Y. Nian
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, National Yunlin University of Science and Technology, Taiwan; Department of Electrical Engineering, National Yunlin University of Science and Technology, Taiwan; Department of Electrical Engineering, National Yunlin University of Science and Technology, Taiwan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: An interleaved three-level converter with the new current doubler rectifier is proposed. The main advantages of the proposed converter are zero voltage switching (ZVS) turn-on for all switches, low output ripple current and less voltage stress of the output diodes. Two three-level converters connected in parallel are used to decrease the input current ripple, as well as to reduce the current rating of power switches. At the secondary side, two current doubler rectifiers sharing the same output filter inductors to reduce the output current ripple. The output capacitance of the power switch and the leakage inductance (or external inductance) are resonant at the transition interval so that the power switches can be turned on under ZVS. Experiments with a prototype with 750-800V input and 48V/30A output are provided to verify the theory analysis.
Author Keywords: Interleaved PWM;ZVS;Converter
INSPEC Controlled Terms: AC-DC power convertors;rectifiers;switching convertors;zero voltage switching

Document Title: Modified current phase angle calculation of inverter-based DGs for eliminating the effects of fault current contribution from synchronous DGs in smart grid
Authors: N. Boonyapakdee; A. Sangswang; M. Konghirun
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, King Mongkut's University of Technology Thonburi, Thailand; Department of Electrical Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, King Mongkut's University of Technology Thonburi, Thailand; Department of Electrical Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, King Mongkut's University of Technology Thonburi, Thailand
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The synchronous distributed generators (SDGs) significantly impact on the protective devices because of their high fault current contribution. The effects of fault current contribution from SDG can be removed by adjusting current phase angle of inverter-based DGs (IBDGs). This paper proposes modified current phase angle calculation for IBDGs. The proposed current phase angle calculation is carried out without the fixed positive constant value (Δ); hence, the improper current phase angle caused by fixed Δ in the conventional method can be remedied. The current phase angle given from proposed calculation is suitable for different unpredictable fault currents from SDG (I<sub>syn</sub>). The effectiveness of the proposed current phase angle calculation is verified with IEEE 33 bus modelled in Matlab/Simulink simulation. In accordance with the simulation results, the proposed current phase angle calculation can clearly eliminate the effects of fault current contribution from SDG.
Author Keywords: Fault current contribution;inverter-based distributed generator;synchronous distributed generator;smart grid
INSPEC Controlled Terms: distributed power generation;fault currents;fault diagnosis;invertors;smart power grids

Document Title: Investigation and modeling of startup techniques for boost DC-DC converters
Authors: H. Wu; C. Huang; C. Wei
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan; Department of Electrical Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan; Department of Electrical Engineering, National Cheng Kung University, Taiwan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This work introduces and discusses the issues of several common startup techniques for boost dc-dc converters. Moreover, basic operating principle of boost converters and three kinds of startup techniques will be briefly introduced in this work, and then an improved method is presented. The mathematical models of two chosen startup methods are built, and MATLAB simulation is used for comparison. In this work, the goal of the startup technique for boost dc-dc converters is to successfully start up the converter at a low input voltage, while effectively limiting the in-rush current at high input voltages.

Document Title: Design and analysis of double-sided linear primary permanent magnet vernier motor
Authors: S. Wang; W. Zhao; M. Kang

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Linear primary permanent magnet vernier (LPPMV) motor incorporates the merits of high efficiency and low cost because its long stator can be designed as simple iron core only with salient poles. In this paper, a new double-sided linear primary permanent magnet vernier (LPPMV) motor is proposed, which artfully adopts appropriate halbach PM arrays. Compared with the existing single-sided LPPMV motor, the proposed motor has over twice thrust force. Also, the proposed motor exhibits relatively enhanced force performance with various optimized structure elements, which is more suitable for long stoke applications.

Abstract: This paper presents a novel design for switched reluctance motors characterized by the reduction of torque ripple and windage loss. Abstract: This paper presents a GaN FET-based 1kW spwm inverter using a promising next generation power semiconductor. Abstract: A special motor with new rotor structure of mixing squirrel cage and permanent magnet is presented in this paper, which can be called as Squirrel Cage Pole-Changing Permanent Magnet Motor (SCPCPMM). Document Title: Novel thin heating coil structure with reduced copper loss for high frequency induction cookers
Authors: M. Hataya; Y. Oka; K. Umetani; E. Hiraki; T. Hirokawa; M. Imai
Author Affiliations: Graduate School of Natural Science and Technology, Okayama Univ., 3-1-1 Tsushimanaka, Kita-ku, Okayama, Japan; Graduate School of Natural Science and Technology, Okayama Univ., 3-1-1 Tsushimanaka, Kita-ku, Okayama, Japan; Graduate School of Natural Science and Technology, Okayama Univ., 3-1-1 Tsushimanaka, Kita-ku, Okayama, Japan; Graduate School of Natural Science and Technology, Okayama Univ., 3-1-1 Tsushimanaka, Kita-ku, Okayama, Japan; Appliance Company, Panasonic Corp., 2-3-1-2, Noji-higashi, Kusatsu, Shiga, Japan; Appliance Company, Panasonic Corp., 2-3-1-2, Noji-higashi, Kusatsu, Shiga, Japan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Litz wire has been widely utilized for heating coils of high frequency induction cookers. However, these coils often suffer from large winding height due to low space factor of Litz wire. Certainly, rectangular wire may reduce the winding height of the coil owing to its high space factor. However, the rectangular wire tends to suffer from large copper loss caused by the skin effect and the proximity effect. In the conventional coil structure of the rectangular wire, these effects cause concentrated AC current distribution, which leads to excessive copper loss. This paper addresses this issue by proposing a novel heating coil structure of the rectangular wire that can homogenize the AC current distribution. This paper also presents the simulation results that successfully verified the effectiveness of the proposed structure.

Abstract: 48 V to 12 V Soft-Switching Interleaved Buck and Boost Converter for mild-hybrid vehicle is proposed. The converter is consist of interleaved buck and boost converter with auxiliary inductor. Resonance between auxiliary capacitors and inductor is used for soft-switching. Therefore, reduction of the passive component size and switching loss can be implemented. Also, optimal design of the auxiliary components is suggested for satisfaction of soft switching. The converter and design method are verified in simulation.

Document Title: Novel receiving coil structure for improving efficiency and power transfer capability of resonant inductive coupling wireless power transfer
Authors: T. Honjo; T. Koyama; K. Umetani; E. Hiraki
Author Affiliations: Okayama University, 3-1-1 Tshushimanaka, Kita-ku, Okayama, Japan; Okayama University, 3-1-1 Tshushimanaka, Kita-ku, Okayama, Japan; Okayama University, 3-1-1 Tshushimanaka, Kita-ku, Okayama, Japan; Okayama University, 3-1-1 Tshushimanaka, Kita-ku, Okayama, Japan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Resonant inductive coupling wireless power transfer (RIC-WPT) is attractive as a convenient power supply method to small mobile apparatus. However, limited size of the receiving coil can limit the efficiency and the power transfer capability. This paper addresses this difficulty by proposing a novel receiving coil structure. The proposed structure has a coil wound on a drum core with a thin axis. The top and the bottom of the drum core has large surface area to effectively collect the magnetic flux for large mutual inductance. In addition, the thin axis can reduce the wire length, thus reducing the parasitic AC resistance. The AC resistance is further reduced by suppressing the proximity effect. Simulation supported probable improvement in the efficiency as well as the power transfer capability. In addition, experiment verified that the proposed structure improved the efficiency by 66% and the power transfer capability by 109%.
Author Keywords: Eddy current;Inductive coupling;Magnetic structure;Wireless power transfer

Abstract: In this paper, an approximation of radial force in highly saturated region of a switched reluctance motor is investigated. From FEM results, it is known that radial force is depending on two components, those are electrical rotational position and current. In addition, the mutual effect of another phase is also included in the approximation. The principle of radial force approximation is based on the Fourier series method.

Document Title: Anti-vibration control system with frame vibration suppression method for sensorless IPMSM-driven applications
Authors: S. Suthep; Y. Wang; M. Ishida; K. Yubai; S. Komada; N. Yamamura
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering Faculty of Engineering, Mie University, Japan; Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering Faculty of Engineering, Mie University, Japan; Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering Faculty of Engineering, Mie University, Japan; Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering Faculty of Engineering, Mie University, Japan; Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering Faculty of Engineering, Mie University, Japan; Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering Faculty of Engineering, Mie University, Japan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motor(PMSM) frame vibrations can represent significant noise problems. In this paper, a novel position sensorless anti-vibration system for PMSM-driven applications is proposed, which is called Specific Component Reduction Controller(SCRC). This controller is derived from repetitive controller with Fourier Transform (FT) (conventional one). Since the repetitive controller has a large gain at desired frequency and multiples, the conventional system may amplify high frequency noise. On the other hand, the novel method, Specific Component Reduction Controller (SCRC), is quite hard to amplify the high frequency noise, because it learns Fourier coefficients to generate a compensation signal. Experimental results show the effectiveness of the proposed IPMSM sensorless driven system with SCRC.

Document Title: Influence of air-gap length on rotor bar current waveform of squirrel-cage induction motor
Authors: T. Gundogdu; Z. Q. Zhu; J. C. Mipo; P. Farah
Author Affiliations: Department of Electronic and Electrical Engineering, University of Sheffield, Sheffield S1 3JD, U.K.; Department of Electronic and Electrical Engineering, University of Sheffield, Sheffield S1 3JD, U.K.; Valeo Powertrain Electric Systems, 94017 Créteil Cedex, France; Valeo Powertrain Electric Systems, 94017 Créteil Cedex, France
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: The rotor bar current in an induction motor (IM) is usually assumed to be sinusoidal. However, it is found that the rotor bar current may become non-sinusoidal even if the stator windings are fed with a sinusoidal source. Influence of air-gap length on the rotor bar current waveform of an IM, which is designed by using the same geometrical and operational parameters as the Toyota Prius 2010 interior permanent magnet machine, has been investigated in depth. It reveals that the air-gap length has a significant effect on the rotor bar current waveform, torque ripple, slot leakage, and efficiency. The conditions when the non-sinusoidal rotor bar current waveform occurs and the reasons behind this phenomenon are investigated by finite element method (FEM).

Abstract: We proposed a topology optimization method that incorporates the concept of cluster and cleaning method in Genetic algorithm (GA). This method can design a rotor structure from the empty space, which has high output power and less permanent magnet volume. In this paper, the effect of strength of the cleaning method on the obtained rotor structure is investigated. Using the optimal strength of the cleaning method, a PMSG is designed, which has higher output power characteristic with less permanent magnet volume than a Prius type generator.

Document Title: Direct torque control of T-NPC three-level inverter fed dual three-phase PMSM drives based on double SVM strategy
Authors: Z. Wang; X. Wang; M. Cheng; W. Hua
Author Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, China; School of Electrical Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, China; School of Electrical Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, China; School of Electrical Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, China
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: In this paper, a double space vector modulation (SVM) based direct torque control (DTC) scheme is proposed for the T type NPC (T-NPC) inverter fed dual three-phase PMSM drives. The proposed scheme provides a solution for high-power and high-reliability motor drives. It inherits the advantages of fast dynamic performance of DTC and good harmonic performance of SVM. Compared to previous vector space decomposition (VSD) based SVM, the proposed double SVM scheme can achieve the same effect in harmonic suppression, while avoiding complicated process of voltage vector synthesis. In the proposed scheme, an additional closed-loop harmonic current controller can further suppress the unbalanced waveforms caused by system asymmetry. The DTC based fault tolerant operation schemes are also proposed for open-switch faults in T-NPC inverters, including both half-bridge switch faults and mid-point clamping switch faults. The experiments are given to verify the proposed double SVM based DTC schemes provide good operating performance for the T-NPC inverter fed dual three-phase PMSM drives.

Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: It is expected that electric railways realize further energy-saving performance. In electric railways, the energy consumption depends on the train scheduling. Therefore, some researches have addressed energy saving by studying train scheduling. One of the researches optimized energy consumption by changing train scheduling based on mathematical models. However, it did not consider uncertainties of operation conditions. Since there inevitably exist uncertainties like adhesion coefficient and vehicle load, those possibly affect the optimality. In this paper, we explicitly consider vehicle load variation. The energy consumption is modeled taking the vehicle load variation into account. Then, we study optimization of energy saving based on the derived energy consumption model. The effectiveness of the optimization approach is validated by simulation studies.

Document Title: Development of high power density converter using flying capacitor multilevel circuits for PV systems

Author Affiliations: Power and Industrial Systems R&D Center, Toshiba Corporation, Japan; Power and Industrial Systems R&D Center, Toshiba Corporation, Japan; Industrial Power Electronics Development & Engineering Department, Toshiba Corporation, Japan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: This paper describes a development of a high power density power converter using flying capacitor multilevel circuits for PV systems. To connect the PV systems to a power grid, a power conditioner system (PCS) is required. Sine wave filters and EMI filters are required to satisfy harmonics regulations such as CISPR. These filters are dominant in a total volume of the PCSs. To design a small PCS to interconnect power grids and the PV systems of homes, the total volume of the PCS must be reduced. In this paper, a high power density converter is designed by using the topology of flying-capacitor multilevel circuits. The experimental results validate the effectiveness of the proposed circuit.

Authors: M. Kasuga; S. Masukawa
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Tokyo Denki University, Japan; Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Tokyo Denki University, Japan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: A new method for reducing harmonics involved in input voltages of a three-phase voltage source diode rectifier is proposed. It is applied to the conventional 6-step diode rectifier with a three-phase autotransformer. By injecting harmonics to the neutral point of the autotransformer from an auxiliary circuit, input voltages of the proposed diode rectifier can be almost the same as a conventional 36-step diode rectifier. In this paper, circuit performances and input voltage waveforms are discussed, and the optimum parameters are determined by taking effect of harmonic reductions. Then, characteristics of the proposed rectifier can be clarified by simulation results.

Document Title: Loss reduction of transformer for LLC resonant converter using a magnetoplated wire
Authors: T. Yamamoto; Y. Bu; T. Mizuno; Y. Yamaguchi; T. Kano
Author Affiliations: Shinshu University, Faculty of Engineering, 4-17-1, Wakasato, Nagano, Japan; Shinshu University, Faculty of Engineering, 4-17-1, Wakasato, Nagano, Japan; Shinshu University, Faculty of Engineering, 4-17-1, Wakasato, Nagano, Japan; Tabuchi Electric CO., LTD., Kinsan Bldg., 3-18-3, Kanda, Nishiki-cho, Chiyoda-ku, Tokyo, Japan; Tabuchi Electric CO., LTD., Kinsan Bldg., 3-18-3, Kanda, Nishiki-cho, Chiyoda-ku, Tokyo, Japan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: To improve the power density of a switching power supply, we attempt to reduce the transformer loss using a magnetoplated wire (MPW). Contrary to using a copper wire, the use of an MPW allows for a reduction of the winding loss component due to the proximity effect. In particular, we investigate the 1-MHz LLC resonant converter using an MPW. A 4.5% decrease in the power loss is achieved, giving 29.4 W at 1 MHz and 1 kW.
Author Keywords: Copper loss;LLC resonant converter;Magnetoplated wire;power density
INSPEC Controlled Terms: power convertors;transformers

Document Title: A study of passive elements for isolated flyback converter
Authors: T. Ohsato; N. Satoh
Author Affiliations: Department of Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, Graduate School of Engineering, Chiba Institute of Technology, Japan; Department of Electrical, Electronics and Computer Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Chiba Institute of Technology, Japan
Publication Title: 2016 19th International Conference on Electrical Machines and Systems (ICEMS)
Abstract: We have developed an insulation-type flyback converter circuit for high-frequency operation. We estimated the high frequency characteristics of passive devices in various areas of the DC-DC converter circuit. We produced a flyback transformer experimentally and evaluated the frequency response properties. In order to verify the fast switching operation, the input and output voltages and currents of the converter were measured for both continuous and discontinuous current operations.
